Grand: It is quite good. The hotel is recommended for eveyone who want to visit Yogyakarta. Thank you for hospitality. What a wonderful and nice place to stay. The hotel is next to the plaza and it is convinient. Dimas.
Yogyakarta: When you stay at Marriott you just don?t have to worry. This was spot on. Beautiful lobby decorated to celebrate CNY. Welcome drink, map and recommendations. Beautiful, clean and luxurious room with a nice view of the pool. Nice, quiet and serene.  I enjoyed the spa and the breakfast and the surrounding mall for a little stroll  The friendly staff recommend Sasanti for dinner where Obama dined with his family once. Nice choice. Also got recommended a nice traditional gudeg restaurant.  I only stayed one night in order to visit Prambanan and then left to visit Borobudur.

Borobudur: Be greeted by a awsome sight of the temple at the entrance. Get a guide to have a good understanding of the meaning of the temple.
Prambanan: This hindu temple is as worth as Borobudor to visit in Jogja. Equally crowded as Borobudor but thanks to wide compound that it seems not so congested. Better bring hats, wear light and comfort. Should take more than two hours if you want calmly wandering around the site as it is?
Sultan: The Tamansari is nestled away in a little neighborhood, making the entrance blend in like many other attractions in Jogja.   The entire complex is quite small, but beautiful. Very pretty fountains good for a photo opp taking a few minutes to cool down in the shade before moving?
Malioboro: Good place to visit when you are in Yogyakarta especially in the evening, you can find lot of food store (but dont expect those are cheap), you may also buy some souvenir and batik.
Artotel: We would a nice stay in ARTOTEL Yogyakarta. The breakfast has the various choices from locals to western. We love the fresh juice anyway! So tempting. Room was so clean. All the interior are artsy, love it. The time before we check out, We got a birthday surprise. Those cakes, fruits and greetings completed our happiness, so sweet and cute. We would love to thank for all the ARTOTEL peeps! Especially Jzulia, Benny, Angga, Umay, Della and Agung who wishing a very happy birthday. They really heART us. Thank you for all the wishes and exceptional service during our stay.  Looking forward to coming back later! ? Stefanus Adi
Grand: It is a good hotel, kindly and friendly staff, luxury hotel, have a spacious room, clean room, breakfast has a variety food and good taste, I hope I wanna back to this hotel....score 10 for grand ambarukmo
Yogyakarta: Absolutely the nicest hotel in Jogjakarta.   The staff are always so friendly and welcoming and always greet us with the warming smile.    At the buffet which we always go to the supervisor Gery was very friendly and professional and had a great chat with us.   100% would recommend this hotel and the buffet!

Borobudur: I really recommended you to visit Borobudur if you visit Yogyakarta or central Java. you will never feel not impressed with the building, the reliefs, Stupas, statues and also you will be fell amazing with the view if you success reached the highest floor. I highly recommended to?
Prambanan: This is on par with the main temple of Angkor Wat (not the entire complex). I am shocked to see the reviews are not more skewed towards 5* as there is nothing short of fabulous here. If you time it right, and show up at end of day, the sunset view is best from where you?
Sultan: It is more of local attractions, which is okay to miss if you have less time. The entry fee is 15000 IDR.  We hardly saw foreign tourists here. The place is not well developed and needs more restaurants and amenities.  A guide is a must for understanding the history of the fort.
Malioboro: The jl. Malioboro, an impressive street near the Kraton ( royal palace of the sultan Hamengkubuwono) . The street is very crowded and with a lot of shops, warungs ( little restaurants) and with the famous becak. Seems it get busier every day.
Artotel: Went here for holiday and was in awe by their decorations and colorful room. All the staff were super friendly, and all the in room services was super cheap. Even the liquor bottle price was worth the money. Loving every corner of this hotel as they install arts along with their decorations. Would definitely come here again in the future!
Grand: Special thanks to Eldina for helping me to arrange my dinner reservation for all you can eat steamboat. All the staff on the restaurant were really helpful and very accommodating. One suggestion is that to add more selection for drinks, the rest perfect and worth the price. Thank you!
Yogyakarta: First time staying there and I?m very impressed with the service from all their staff. Front counter and service staff are polite, warm and friendly. Engineering staff are quick to respond. My room?s hotel card reader had a faulty battery and the staff managed to replace within 15minutes.  Location is about 25 minutes to the Adisucipto Airport.  Hartono mall is directly beside the hotel.  For sightseeing, Malioboro area is about 30 minutes drive from the hotel.  I like the general ambience of the hotel as it is quiet and peaceful.

Borobudur: Its always better to be there early morning. Sunrise can be seen from the temple and it is an incredble sight. Since its about 2 KM walk from the entrance and has to climb 800 appx steps on to the top its always better be there early as possible. It will help to come down when?
Prambanan: The temple was built in about nine century. It is area is huge. The magnificent stone temples and statues are impeccable architecture wonders of ancient time. This is out side of Yogjakarta city; a day tour by car or tourists bus is fine. The premises are well maintained, clean?
Sultan: Quick visit very instructive. The palace is nice . Included the mosque very atopic interest to see .
Malioboro: I did my undergrad in Yogyakarta so I am very familiar with this place and I always make time to come here every time I visit Yogyakarta
Artotel: I stayed for 3 nights with my family on January 2020. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay! The room is very clean, room design is artsy, and breakfast is varied.  Every corner of this hotel is very aesthetic. I really love the gold slide in the lobby. If you plan to stay here, I suggest you to take some pictures in front of some artsy walls.  There is also live music at M floor in 2 of the 3 nights of my stay here (Friday and Saturday night).  Not to mention, this hotel is also family friendly. I saw many people bring their child to play at the pool.  Will definitely come back here when I go to Yogyakarta again someday.
Grand: It was the first time I stayed at Grand Ambarukmo Hotel. Without doubt I choose this hotel because I think its very strategic hotel, which is near from mall, near from cullinary area. Upon arrival I was warmly welcomed by the staff at receptionist. All the staff I met is very friendly and helpful. The room I had was very spacious and well equipment with all essentials, and I have no hestitation in recommending this hotel. It really felt like home to me.  And the last I really want to say thankyou to Grace, she really smart and helpful to arrange all of my business activities while I was there.
Yogyakarta: Very nice big room with there is bluetooth JBL speaker for clock and alarn and able to connect handphone as well. Nice and bid bath room as well Highspeed free wifi works well The food variation during my 4 nights stay is quite same everyday

Borobudur: The temple is incredible and well restored. Go in the morning when less people and not so hot. However; Too many guards make taking a pic with no one in it difficult, and they don?t seem to be doing anything anyway. Kids with megaphones shouting and climbing all over showing?
Prambanan: Honestly, it is not really worth the price (around CAD$35 if a remember correclty), except if you are attempting to get Instagramable shots. The main temple is nice, but the other smaller ones are much nicer. What made me really sad about the Temples is that people (and especially?
Sultan: Nice place to visit with guide explaining history of the place. Takes at least an hour to see all sights and most of all taste good Luwak coffee. Be warned it is expensive though.
Malioboro: Very nice and tipical street with all that we need concentrated. The better is maybe to go at end of afternoon or evening. There is also mall and tipical food to have a break.
Artotel: I had a very pleasant stay at Artotel Jogja. The front desk staff (Nila, rosa & Julia) were very friendly, quick and accomodating. Every corner of the hotel is very instagramable, aesthetic and artsy. Would definitely come back <U+2665><U+FE0F>
Grand: It was a good place for us to spend weekend then start week day here.  Well fast response of staffs, we had twice experience (breakfast on the first day we got hot tea as compliment after gave our opinion on their survey & technician came as quick as they could when we called because of sink trouble).  We will be back as soon as possible <U+0001F604>
Yogyakarta: Trying for first time to experience wonderful holiday in Marriott Yogya and surprisingly turn out to be wonderful for our family there.   It was great to see how they claimed themselves as Five Star Hotel with Five Star standard from Services, Quality of Breakfast, Facilities and speed of their staffs.   Pleasure place to come back again for holiday or business.

Borobudur: went for the sunrise visit.. unfortunately that day there wasnt any. but still the size and architecture was just amazing. definitely a must visit place of your jogya trip.
Prambanan: Nice place to see the historic constructions.  A combined ticket for Prambanan and borobudur is 630k ( only prambanan costs 350k).  Can reach using public buses from Yogya city.  the facilities at the location is good.  Visit when in Indonesia!
Sultan: Beautifull water castle, cheap ticket, easy to go, friendly and clever staffs or tour guide. Amaze me so much
Malioboro: I walked on the street many times and always met nice indonesien who wanted to speak French with me ;) at night you can listen many groups who make music from bambou instruments, sounds really peaceful !
Artotel: The hotel is very clean and aesthetic. The service is excellent, I was served by Rosa and Jzulia, they are really friendly, polite and helpful. Definitely would stay here again if i visit yogyakarta!!
Grand: i forgot how many i spent holiday at this homy hotel. continue from my last review several months ago, once again i spend holiday right there and have a lovely night at its lounge. an arcadaz lounge, if im not wrong the name o its hotels lounge. i just drink beer and enjoy the atmosphere o the lounge, i also talk much with its kind staff name Silvia, she told me so many things bout the lounge and also askin me for what i need to drink or eat that night. the band too i like to enjoy their music although im jealous at once cause im a musician too haha. okay thats all my review o its hotels lounge name Arcadaz. you guys should try to 5th floor beside the swimmin pool to enjoy the drink and food right there. a recommended one i think <U+2764>
Yogyakarta: I had a very enjoyable and restful stay here, over a week in December. The staff were great, with the Executive Lounge staff particularly good. The breakfast was excellent. The staff throughout the hotel were (mostly) excellent ---I was a little disappointed with the hotel is inability to coordinate a business meeting for me (between not understanding how and then taking too long to try to arrange it). Apart from this, though, it was an outstanding stay. Strongly recommend.

Borobudur: This 9th-10th century complex is one of the oldest religious sites in the world and its surprising to see the shear size and architecture of it.  Every corner and every spot of this place is unique.  The King who made is same who made Angkor Wat in Cambodia.  The place requires?
Prambanan: It was a nice temple, great sunset at Prambanan temple. Also good indonesian people that really kind to us. Nice guide that help us know the stories about Prambanan also
Sultan: rustic looking water castle not that impressive. cheap entry ticket. advised to visit on wkdays to avoid crowd
Malioboro: Malioboro street is the most important place in Yogyakarta. It is full of Batik (handcrafted cloths) shops and eateries. There are tongas and rickshaw all around. You have western food options like Dunkin Donuts and Pizza Hut. The Malioboro Mall is also on the same street.  It is?
Artotel: Nice place to stay but a little bit noisy from other room. Thank is to Abi in reception for helping me about information around hotel. Internet speed is good, but need to improve for signal quality from inside room. Strategic location and artistic hotel. Thank you.
Grand: I stayed in this hotel for more than a week, and I am so satisfy with the service from all the staff, they were very helpful and friendly, the bed was very comfortable, the room was very clean, breakfast also great and this hotel is very close the mall. I would definitely stay in this hotel again when I come back to jogja.
Yogyakarta: I am writing this review on behalf of my mom. She spent two nights in this hotel with my father and my sister is family. The hotel is modern, relatively new, with huge rooms and hollywood type of single beds. The bathroom is clean and spacious enough. But what matters most is the housekeeping and kitchen service: a prompt response and attentive. Keep up the good work, guys!

Borobudur: We booked the sunrise @Borobudur Temple via Jogjakarta Local Tours. The driver, Adit picked us up from the hotel at 3.45am. It took about an hour from Eastparc Hotel Jogja to Borobudur Temple.   It was quite packed when we reached there. Many were already there ?squatting at?
Prambanan: 4 of us thought we could complete Borobudur and PRAMBANAN TEMPLE IN THE MORNING AND EVENING. we made it but we had to cut corners at Prambanan temple . This is unesco heritage and you really need to spend more than half a day in this Hindu temple . We entered the temple around?
Sultan: What a beautiful place, friendly and nice tour guide. The ticket a little expensive but it is not a big problem  cause you will feels satisfied what is in the inside especially the history
Malioboro: Maliboro is an icon of Yogyakarta. You could not said you had go to Indonesia, especially Yogyakarta if you were not stand on this famous street. So many something pleasant here.
Artotel: First impression: This hotel could be considered a family hotel with a modern twist. The most memorable experience would be the staff and the interior of the hotel. The staff were nice, dressed fashionably casual, full of smile, and helpful. We checked in (it was a breeze) much much earlier than intended and our room were ready so we could place our luggage, cool down for a bit and continue our journey. The slide from level M to the lobby is an interesting touch, even though it is not slippery enough for you to use it like normal slide (maybe safety concern?).   Nice location: this hotel is surrounded by countless of food stalls and restaurants, you would never be starved.   The room: The room smelled a bit funny at first but it was not that unpleasant. Amenities were great, even?
Grand: I now felt regret for only staying 1 night in this beautiful hotel. The room is Lux, although the bathroom a bit small but have a good space for me as single business traveller. The bed is Best! I had a good sleep after tiring full day meeting. What i like the most is that the room has a very good lighting where i still need to work at night.  Breakfast is also surprisingly very good with good variety. I had the gudeg which is yummy, freshly made carrot tomato juice upon my order, a very yummy traditional jamu. Bakery taste good <U+0001F44D>  Happy to come back at the soonest <U+0001F60A>
Yogyakarta: Stayed here on October on business trip. This hotel has everything for you : a very nice and beautiful room, very good breakfast, nice location beside a huge shopping mall, and most of all, a huge and so beautiful swimming pool on the roof. It is fantastic !  Hope to have a chance to stay again one day at Marriott Yogya ! Good job guys !

Borobudur: Went to visit this beautiful temple in January, it was a low season and was not overcrowded, however, there were some tourists and had to wait for awhile to get pictures without people in it. If you like architecture and temples - that is a place to go. Go with the guide as they?
Prambanan: Beautiful Temple!  you can see big statue inside the temple. the weather was hot. make sure you bring umbrella..
Sultan: By the time I reached the place, it was closed. So, while I cannot share a review of the interiors, let me share a review of the vicinity. Nice mosque, good paintings at various spots and a quick walk to Alun Alun.
Malioboro: Malioboro is a must on any visit to Yogyakarta. The heart of the city, this is where locals converge for being busy (shopping) and being relaxed (strolling), Tourists join the proceedings as well. Consequently, the place is vibrant and offers you a chance to buy just about?
Artotel: Me and family decided to stay in Artotel for our short vacation in Yogyakarta.  Design of hotel is artistic and modern. Location in Jalan Kaliurang is strategic for those who want to go to Merapi or City Center. Breakfast is continental huge!!! A large variety of food, in local and international style. The resto is by the side of the swimming pool; moreover, our daughter Alessia has been gifted with a small bear doll by the very kind Ms. Jzulia that handled our breakfast that morning.  The checkout process is very easy as well! The staff in the reception are prompt and professional, particularly Citra, Rossa, and Reynaldi!  We are looking forward to stay there again.<U+0001F970>
Grand: After 5 years not visiting Yogyakarta, finally we had a chance to come back here, to Yogyakarta. Because we loved to stay at different hotel, so we checked several hotels before. And finally pick this hotel. It is because the price is affordable and we can have corporate rate. Corporate rate is that they have an agreement with the company that I worked for. I stayed with my husband and 2 teenagers. The room is big enough for 4 of us. And we choose the floor with the same floor as the swimming pool that is at the 5th floor. Actually, our first choice is at Royal Ambarrukmo, but unfortunately, we do not get the room that we choose. So, because Grand Ambarrukmo is also with the same management, and also across the Plasa Ambarrukmo, we decided to stay here. It is really comfy and the?
Yogyakarta: It?s a beautiful and big hotel in Yogyakarta. This hotel is next to a shopping mall so it?s very convenient if someone is looking for places to eat with food court and nice restaurants. Check in was fast. The hotel is very nice and beautiful. If you have a Marriott status beyond Gold you can eat breakfast at the M lounge or/and at the restaurant. There?s not much of choices at the lounge but the restaurant has many choices. Food at the restaurant:The broth for the noodles soup wasn?t consistent one day was great other day was so bland. Some servers don?t understand English well and one out of 4 days I was there, I had to wait almost 30 minutes for my tea after repeatedly asking for my tea several time The M lounge doesn?t have much choices for either food or desserts and they?

Borobudur: One of Indonesian famous Temple compound, build in three tiers: a pyramidal base with five concentric square terraces, the trunk of a cone with three circular platforms and a monumental stupa at the top.  My previous visits was decades ago, and at this moment I?m bringing my son?
Prambanan: The temple Prambanan is beautiful and definitely worth a visit, even thought it?s very pricy and for us it was not as impressive as Borobudur. The parc surrounding the temple also doesn?t have as much to offer as the Borobudur parc.   I would give the temple 4 stars if it wasn?t?
Sultan: Do not come in the weekend, bunch of teenages so loud and they made picture in every step, and other tourist didnt seem want to give you time even 1 second to make picture, seemed they also wanted to part of your memorable pictures.. but somehow I managed to get a pic without?
Malioboro: The distinctive road and well know icon in Yogyakarta. This road and its surrounding are centre of tourist attractions. Very popular and crowded during holiday seasons. Close to Yogyakarta train station, it also is surrounded by lots of hotels, sidewalk shops and restaurants.?
Artotel: **Honest Review  This hotel is an artistic hotel. With a good strategic location. The room was good. The facilty was nice and the staffs so humble.  One of reccomended hotel in Jogja. I felt amaze with the colorful and artistic painting in every walls. The room was clean, the facilty was complete. They serve coffee maker in every rooms. But The minus of the room is the size of the bathroom. Bathroom was too small. But It is ok because We spend not more than 30 minutes in bathroom.   Breakfast menu so many option to be choosen. Various meals and drink, And yes they serve you soft drink. Different menu for everyday. This hotel also provide hand made lamin in certain day. There is also available healthy drink and herbs.   The staffs are so humble, full of smile and ready to assist u.?
Grand: I just stayed for a day on this hotel. The located about 10min from airport and across from Ambarrukmo Mall Plaza.  They have many choicess for breakfast and delicious dish. I have been at Arcadaz Bar at 5th floor. They was live music and DJ Also, Big thank is to Eny, for the hospitality, friendly and warmth service, It was very pleasure for me and my familly. Thank you for effort to show me the nice atraction for making nice cocktails at the pool. Over all has very recommendation  for stay.
Yogyakarta: The hotel is very nice and new. Big room and bed and they also have big sofa in the room. Very good for family visit. Behind big mall (Hartono Mall). Good swimming pool. Very rcommended to stay here when visit Jogja.

Borobudur: huge Hindus temple, amazing...I like it,1 hour from Yogyakarta by car.if you want to go there better in the morning or afternoon around 3 pm when you reach Borobudur temple around 11-2 pm, the weather is hot enough or will be better if you bring an umbrella
Prambanan: Came to Prambanan after going for the borobudur sunrise and mendut temple visit. The tickets are pricey but well worth the price since they are putting in a lot of money and effort in rebuilding the temples. Many of the smaller temples have been destroyed by earthquakes but the?
Sultan: Great when you get there, but can be hard to find on foot. Best to find a guide to show you round as it?s not obvious where everything is. One found us at the gate and was very informative. He seemed happy with his 50000 rupiah tip after an hour and a half showing us round but?
Malioboro: Not for the faint hearted, Malioboro Road is the seething heart of Yogyakarta. This is where Indonesians go on mass to stroll, eat and shop. It appears to be busy all of the time, the later it gets the busier it gets. Hundreds of shops and stalls selling all sorts of things?
Artotel: It took only 30min from the airport. Great warm greetings from the bellboy and receptionist. Helpful as well. The room was great, clean, spacey. One thing that something wrong with the tv channel on our last day. Just an input because some people need tv more than I do, who only turn on the tv to accompany me while I?m sleeping. lol Breakfast was also great. Reasonable price for the food. Many places in the lobby area, the room floor and in the room are instagramable.  Oh you have friendly staff. Greetings to the guests wherever they met. Cool!
Grand: This hotel is very pleasant and a very nice place to stay. Ratio quality price is very high. Sunny this is very helpful and can give you a lot of hints about Yogya. Hotel food is very delicious. Hotel cosmetics are of high quality. We recommended this place.
Yogyakarta: Stayed with two kids for 4 nights. Enjoyed every bit of my stay from Checkin to check out. The staff are very courteous and cordial. The breakfast was excellent.  Rooms are spacious and clean. Both restaurants are great. Especially liked the pizza and other menu of Taman Sari. Pool is big and clean. Spa was also very nice. All in all a excellent stay....

Borobudur: Only two stars. Should have been one. The temple is worth seeing but like in many tourist places in Indonesia it is a total rip off! Segregation on entry between locals and tourists. It is ok to charge tourists slightly more but to charge 6 times more than local is just?
Prambanan: We come in the morning so have enough time to explore the temple. This place more nice that Borobudur since a lot of trees around, public transport with rent available in a strategic spot and they also have the playground. But the toilet was poor, stinky and dirty.
Sultan: We hired a private guide for a walking tour of the historic part of the city for the day, which proved great value for money (although quite draining as it was 34c). Stop No 2 was the Water Castle which for me was the tour highlight. There is quite a lurid history to this place,?
Malioboro: Too busy. But you have to see it. Crazy nightlife just out of control. Basically it is a huge market where you can find absolutely everything.
Artotel: Hotelnya artsy, the staffs were all great. During checked in, di handle sama mas mas ga recognized namanya but he is awesome. While staying house keeping juga need to be appreciated. Checked out handled by FDA named Citra. She is smart and friendly.  Will back again here someday.
Grand: the room is clean, the staff helpful, the food wastern and traditional food available. thanks to Ms.Sanni the hotel staff, the location near to airport, not too far from city center, shopping mall in front of the hotel. i will probably stat at this hotel.
Yogyakarta: Good: + Platinum member upgrade to suite with pool view + Breakfast Buffet + M Lounge, all food, drinks and staff were great. I mean staff I barely interacted with addressed me by name (!) amazing. + Calling the nurse when I got sick and helping me get some food.  I really want to give 5 stars, but some areas need to highlight. Bad:  - Dirty bath towel, this was raised with housekeeping and staff has genuinely apologised - which I appreciate. I feel this was a one-off and not the norm. - Almost need to fight for published benefits. I booked a rate that gave up to 15% F+B credit per night, at first I suspected a mis-communication for the refusal. Only after firmly, but politely showing the T+C on the Marriott website did they accept.  - Bonus points still not posted to my account?

Borobudur: Mystic and beautiful temples. A mixture of Buddhist and Hindu styles. Do the sunrise tour and hope there is no fog!!
Prambanan: Javanese people were very friendly and helpful.  This is a clean place and they are maintaining it very well.  Worth the trip
Sultan: Better to get a guide as some areas are not openly visible to tour, esp the mosque. Interesting history to the place with sultans and earthquakes, river that disappeared, passages below water level. The place was a bit small though.
Malioboro: I stayed five for 5 days in Yogyakarta, and went to Malioboro Street every night because my hotel was 10 minutes walking distance away. Every time I went, usually in the evening, it had a different vibe. It is a long road, bustling with people and lined with lots of stalls, and?
Artotel: Read the great review and book 6 nights wih them. We requested the non smoking room even when the front office asked the same question we said the same while showing we bring infant. But when we arrived in the 9th floor we greeted by floor full of smoke and when we entered the room it was definitely smoking room. We called the front office directly and turned out they forgot to inform us, really? We asked them to change the room, the staff helped but with a lot of confusion. Definitely not the hotel you choose if you go with family!
Grand: I have stayed twice at this hotel.  This hotel is located in front of Plaza Ambarrukmo mall, close to airport and not far from Tugu railway station.  Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. I stayed at a Grand Deluxe room by the generosity of Mr. Didin. Comfortable and spacious enough. Wifi worked well.  Breakfast : Various kind of Indonesian food : soto, fried rice, fried noodle, boiled peanut, sweet potatoes, traditional snacks.  Croissant, danish pastry, donuts were ok.  Etc
Yogyakarta: I would highly recommending this hotel as excellent services provided by the team right from check in to M Club staff, the staff that particular to mention, Sofien in the M Club and Ridwan, duty manager as well as the front desk team, Carolina and Aya. Thx for looking after me during my stay in this excellent hotel.

Borobudur: Majestic structure. It was bigger than I have expected. We took 2 hours just to walk around the varioius levels of the main structure. We did not have time to fully explore the surrounding musems and area.
Prambanan: This is the first time I revisit Prambanan temple since 1990s. It is an amazing and grandeur place to visit. What impress me is the fact that those temples are built without using modern technology is an engineering marvel of bygone era. I also like the fact that the temple?
Sultan: It is very close from my home, only 5 minutes by scooter. This place so affordable, cause not so many things to be done here. Located in the city center, you could get here by walking from malioboro.
Malioboro: This is probably the most busiest road in Yogyakarta day and night. Every tourist is here.... it is like you have not been to Yogyakarta if you did not visit Malioboro Road Shopping. It is a long street that eventually leads you to the Royal Palace. The street comes alive at night as?
Artotel: Had a very pleasant stay for 3 nights stay. The interior design this hotel was very artsy and made me feel like I am home. The first thing that catches my eyes when I entered the hotel was the slide in the lobby area and guests were allowed to slide. The room also has an artsy design and neat, the bed was comfortable enough so I had a good sleep quality. The breakfast was tasty and if you are looking for the culinary experience then this hotel is a perfect place to stay because it is located in Jalan Kaliurang where there were lots of restaurants or food stalls.
Grand: Just stayed for 10 days at Grand Ambarrukmo in Jogjakarta. This hotel is located conveniently across from Ambarukkmo Mall, the main shopping plaza in Jogja. Rooms are clean and well equipped. Breakfast is delicious and caters for both Indonesian and Western people.  Like many good hotels, Grand Ambarrukmo has quality staff in every department. These people make you feel extremely welcome. Cannot speak highly enough of their hospitality and warmth. Thank you so much to Eny, Sylvia, Adit, Dony and Alvin (also known as) Blackie.  These guys are in the Lounge area on the 5th floor which has Live Bands ( quality) on Saturday nights and Karaoke if you fancy yourself as an entertainer on Fridays.  All in all a great place to base yourself for everything Jogja has to offer.  I?
Yogyakarta: Stayed for 3 nights. Loves the spacious room and comfortable bed. View was nice with a bit of city view and mountains at the back.  We particularly enjoyed the pool very much. 4 pools for different age group hence I have uninterrupted laps at adult pool. Jucuzz jet is av at all 3 pools just nice to relieve back, leg and calfs muscleache.  Breakfast was yummy, I  particularly love the jamu and the Waffle and French toast. Must try.

Borobudur: Borobudur, Boro means Temple and Budur means Hill. One of the most, if not the most iconic Buddhist temple in the universe. It is one of the 7 wonders. It really is a wonder. The priciseness of its architecture is mindblowing, so much detail. The stories, the history, the?
Prambanan: The minute you reach to the front of the temple, is so grand and it was wow factor. Need to take your time to explore each monument and walk around each platform. Is very small area, tight on each temple. The temple itself hold Shiva which lack of light to see clearly, (should?
Sultan: Went there few times and always discover new spots. pay extra for your camera. the best spot is quite hidden. so not only the water ponds, explore further more to the previous underground mosque ... somehow its always busy with instaphoto hunters
Malioboro: Today I spent afew hours walking up and down this street. It is a must visit place when in Yogyakarta. Plenty of shops and food and cheap coffee stalls. What more can you ask for.
Artotel: I booked 3 rooms with my friend and every single thing is just awesome. Located in the center, so you can go anywhere easily.  Art everywhere.  Staffs are amazing! From the reservation process to check out are flawless.  Receptionists, security, FB team, and housekeeping showed a high level of hospitality.
Grand: For 650k at weekend and include breakfast, this acomodation is worth to try, location at the opposite of plaza ambarukmo, is help to find many food taste and everything you needed, have a free shuttle bus to plaza, front desk is fast service, kingkoil bed, minibar, good rain shower and ecoflush toto is a high quality amenities ,, good lighting room inside, for pool is small but clean at 5 floor, breakfast is internasional std for 4* level, to come this hotel, you must ride by grab or taxi from airport or Tugu train station, grab about 40k, overall this hotel is 8/10 value <U+0001F600><U+0001F44D><U+0001F3FC>
Yogyakarta: As a Bonvoy Titanium member, I booked 2 rooms for family vacations in Yogyakarta. Using Suite Award, one of the room was upgraded with a connecting room. The rooms are fantastic. I guess partly the hotel overall is fairly new.  Why I am giving this only a 3 star is because of couple of things :  1) The M Lounge - I do not think it lives up to Marriott Lounge Standard. This looks like Courtyard by Marriott at MOST. I have enjoyed a better service of Courtyard By Marriott in India - Yes, India, Not Indonesia.  2) Some of the staff, does not behaves like serving guests in 5* Marriott. Sorry to say, this is not even hitting the basic of 5*. This is especially at the back office. Ther are fairly arrogant to spell out the ground rules - Is that how they treat someone who gives 100?

Borobudur: Amazing Temple. 4th Trip here but the first time doing the sunset tour. It was excellent and a free breakfast included. Try to get a day that isnt very cloudy to see the perfect sunrise from one amazing temple.
Prambanan: The temple complex is confusing without a quide.  All temples have main deities in them.  Reminds you of other areas in Southeast Asia and India.
Sultan: I arrived here on weekdays morning (not a holiday), so it is not very crowded. There are some cool places to take a picture on. But I did not, haha. There are brochures in English too. Do not worry.
Malioboro: Came here many times. This is a walking street about 1 km long with many batik, souvenirs and food hawkers (lecehan). Hawker food here are the most expensive in the whole of Yogyakarta. You pay only half the price at outskirt of this street. But souvenirs and clothing are cheap?
Artotel: I stayed there for 3 nights. The athmosphere was very unique & suiteable for teenager. The room was great and clean. The location is strategic , near from everywhere. Check in process was simple and great (thank you to the person who handle us, she is friendly). Breakfast was excellent, lot of choices and tasty. All staff was helpful and friendly also security was great. They always help us to valet our car. All front desk staff was excellent. Special thanks to : Rey, Adi, Yudha. Definitely will come back to Artotel Yogya if we go to Yogya next time. Thank you very much for your kindness, keep it up <U+0001F60A>
Grand: Very modern and spacious room. Room service has a good selection of food and beverages. Restaurant provides a buffet breakfast with loads of choices as well as lunch and dinner. Relaxing outdoor pool on the 5th floor with service staff. All the staff were great and extremely helpful with any request. The Ambarrukmo Mall is directly over the road providing shopping and food court. Local eateries are only a very short walk if you want to sample what the locals eat. Hard to beat for the quality, price and location.
Yogyakarta: Great hotel n great services large swimming pool n good food. Breakfast was awesome! So many variaties.  Swimming pool also good. They have kids pool and adult pool. Fitness room was nice. The club lounge was ok with free drinks. But the food and snack was until 8.00 pm only (I think this should be reconsidered by the management). Location was good... just beside the hartono mall (the biggest mall in jogja). Staffs were friendly and helpful.

Borobudur: There is no doubt that Borobadur is a magnificent temple and it is well worth a visit. The site has been beautifully restored and the upper levels, in particular, are inspirational with their many Buddha statues and stupas.  The light is best for photographs at sunrise and?
Prambanan: I will not review the temple per se as many before me did that. But I would like to comment on the price and the official tourist guide for the temple. 1) Price: 25 USD (which is more expensive than Taj Mahal, but not even close to the grandness of Taj Mahal). We bought a combo?
Sultan: It is alright, you can take some decent photos. Entrance fee of 15000 rupiah per person is maybe a bit exaggerated, but not a big deal. Inside, theres not much to see besides a few pools. The interior of the buildings is not really worth it. Just concrete and it looks all the?
Malioboro: In the morning, the street is hot and traffic is jamp. At night, road show, entertainment, food stall are starting. It is crowded and fun. So, stay nearby here to enjoy yr night!
Artotel: Very homey and cute hotel to stay. I had a very nice and pleasant stay during my two days business trips. My seminar located at Hyatt Hotel Yogyakarta, but I chose to stay here since this place gave more homey feeling. Located at very strategic road, near Gajah Mada University with its lively and happening activities, this hotel really gives you  pleasant feeling, surrounded by many restaurants and food stalls.
Grand: I had stayed in this hotel some time ago. Now, I am coming back to here. Nice hotel. Good food, good ambience and very helpful staff, especially mbak Chandra. Thank you for serving the nice cup of cappuccino<U+0001F60A>.
Yogyakarta: Wow, Western hotels in Asian countries are very true at being nice lodging options for a relatively cheaper price than what you would pay in the States. As this was probably one of the nicest Marriott hotels I?ve ever stayed at, I had a very nice and pleasant experience and would recommend guests to consider this hotel for your lodging option in Yogyakarta.  The hotel is located northwest of the airport less than 4 miles, took maybe 20 minutes by car. The hotel is in a very good location, adjacent to the Hartono Mall which I think is one of the bigger shopping malls in Yogyakarta.   Hotel staff were all very friendly and quick to smile and help. What I like about hotels here in Asia is that they acknowledge you for being a Marriott elite member. Even being Silver back in the?

Borobudur: Borobudur is a big temple. It has lots of stairs to cover in one day. Take your tour early in the morning to avoid crowd and hot sun. Prepare for sunscreen, sun glasses, hats and umbrella to prevent sunburn. Bring plenty of water for hydration. Do not stop for souvenirs unless?
Prambanan: Prambanan temple complex was badly demolished in a major earthquake for about ten years ago. The main temples are raised and beautifully restored, while a vast amount of buildings still lie in heap of stones.  Nevertheless, this place has power to it. The Prambanan temple?
Sultan: We love visiting this place , it?s beautiful and full with history , the enterance fee is 0.5 cent for domestic and 1$ for foreigner .  And u can take guide and paid as you please ( they don?t put the price tag ) but they happy to lead u and explain to u the story in each?
Malioboro: Sometimes you habe to stop your wife from.buying the whole market. In other words there are many bargains. I can certainly recommend this street for browsing around. One remark.it is crowded.
Artotel: Artsy hotel that has unique lobby and interior design. They put javanese touch in furnitures. Bedroom and bathroom ware very homey and clean, not too small not to spacious. Lighting was good and proper. You do not need to worry of craving food because the hotel located in Jalan Kaliurang, one of main road in Jogja with so many restaurant / food stall. But the hotel also provides nice breakfast. Absolutely will come back again.
Grand: Very good service with quick response,, especially when breakfast time, coz  all waitress always stay to helpfully with brings you all recommended menu like jamu as herb drink traditional from Java Island..Thank you Mrs. Intan Anggraini, we always can not forget with your friendly services.
Yogyakarta: The room was spacious, beautiful, and clean. What I like the most was the bed.. they were big enough to fit 1 child and 1 adult. We booked for twin room and the bed size was 160x200m per bed!  Breakfast was awesome! So many variaties.  Swimming pool also good. They have kids pool and adult pool. Fitness room was nice. The club lounge was ok with free drinks. But the food and snack was until 8.00 pm only (I think this should be reconsidered by the management). Location was good... just beside the hartono mall (the biggest mall in jogja). Staffs were friendly and helpful.  Cons: no sauna and steam room.

Borobudur: Majestic. The place is now clean and well managed. We are not allowed to bring food but only water. <U+0001F44D>
Prambanan: Prambanan Temple in Yogyakarta was claimed to be erected in 850 AD. Comprising the remains of some 244 temples, World Heritage?listed Prambanan is Indonesia is largest Hindu site and one of Southeast Asia is major attractions.   Main highlight is the central compound with eight?
Sultan: This is a really nice palace to walk around and observe. Attended on a day where VIP?s were attending believed to be Malaysian PM so higher security than normal. Great way to while away an hour or so and some very scenic spots for photos - well worth seeing.
Malioboro: A walk along Jalan Marlioboro is always an essential when visiting Yogyakarta. I was tempted not to go this time as it was a short visit but was very pleased I did because the bustle of this main street is irresistible. The surprise was the changes that have been made since I?
Artotel: I stay here for 2 night.. requested for king size bed, but they gave me twin bed. Can not sleep cause u can hear very clearly what people discussed beside ur room. You can hear loud sound when you turn on the water or other room turn on the water. Never ever will stay in this hotel. Totally dissapointed.
Grand: Honestly, this hotel was great in cleanness, well maintained, friendly staffs, many varieties of foods on breakfast. I could not ask for more.  The interior of the hotel is modern and i love to have rain shower in bathroom and all amenities was provided by the hotel. When i requested to have good view room, they were able to accommodate it easily without any hassle.  The only dislike maybe the traffic surrounding the hotel was quite bad but they provided security to help you enter the road.  Certainly, i will consider this hotel in future to spend a day or so. Well done Grand Ambarrukmo
Yogyakarta: I have been coming to the Mariott in Jogja for almost 2 years. The rooms are big, the breakfast buffet is excellent and most importantly, the service. At M lounge, Sofie, Dicie, Iin and their colleagues have amazing service. I come here every 2-3 mths and the Mariott is the only place we choose to stay at. Thanks so much everyone.

Borobudur: I have always heard about how grand the the Borobudur Buddha temple is and it is better than I imagined. It was a huge temple with so many stupas and Buddha statues, a four sided identical arrangement. It involves a bit of climbing and walking. But, what a great sight, it was.?
Prambanan: Prambanan temple is best suited to visit around sunset. The temple complex is huge but you can visit three main temples.  The temple is around thousand years old and a part of our restored recently. It is very different than Bali temples.  Entry fee is very high (350k IDR) for?
Sultan: Well if you have time to kill it can be an option otherwise not worth the stop   There is a lot of person visiting. Not easy access with baby trolley
Malioboro: Malioboro is very crowdedwith tourists come...many choice to shopping merchandise and special  gift from jogja
Artotel: Had a very pleasant stay for our company outing. Mba Nungky was really helpful and attentive to our requests. The hotel itself is very artsy and close to famous restaurants and cafes. Would love to come here again on my next visit to Jogja
Grand: the service is good, all the food literally taste awesome, the local even the western. looking forward to visit again in the next travel with family or maybe with friends. thankyou grand ambarukmo hotel @indahpuspitasari
Yogyakarta: Im stay here for a night, and this is a perfect hotel Bcoz i book the room with M Club which is we can try all u can drink coctail with perfect sidedish. Last but not least, Sofie help us to stay here, she so kind give us late check out for the next day. Overall PERFECT hotel

Borobudur: I had wanted to visit since I was a teenager. Maybe I had built up my expectations too much. The size of the temple seemed small. Maybe my visit to Angkor in Cambodia before this influences my opinion.   The price is very steep, the surroundings too manicured, you have to go?
Prambanan: Beautiful temple, definitely go at sunset! We went during off season which was really nice because it wasn?t as busy <U+0001F60A>
Sultan: It is a lovely setting with beautiful pools, but absolutely not a jot of info anywhere. So it is worth going to see the wonderful architecture but don?t expect to understand it! It?s a very cheap ticket and the staff were friendly. Make sure to visit all areas, the underground?
Malioboro: It is mostly souvenirs and food. Souvenirs are all the same after seeing a few stalls. There is nice stuff though and cheap prices. You HAVE to bargain. Even the sale person will tell you that if you say no, too much. And easy to bargain as well! Can get very busy though.
Artotel: A very artsy hotel and cute. Comfortable bed and the staff were very friendly and remembers your name.   But the room are not sound proof. I can still hear what people are talking about next door.   Thankfully they are not party people who partied all night long and only talk so I can sleep.   Nice food as well.   Good quality hotel.
Grand: Hotels with good service, strategic location, clean, plenty of breakfast menus. Do not forget to visit the lounge on the 5th floor near the pool. Thanks Silvia Riana for the service that impressed us. I will be back
Yogyakarta: My husband and I had an excellent stay in Yogyakarta Marriott Hotel. The room and facilities are modern, spacious and well-equipped. The check-in and check-out process by Citra and Sofie were seamless. There was a wide spread of both western and local food at the breakfast buffet, and the staff (Cindy and another trainee) offered to make healthy tea and juice for us. The staff also prepared breakfast boxes for us the morning we were headed to the Borobodur Sunrise Tour. The hotel is also conveniently located next to Hartono Mall, where there is a CGV cinema and plenty of food options (we loved Pawon?e). We will definitely stay here if we visit Yogyakarta again!

Borobudur: Arrangement of both Sunrise & Sunset from Manohara Restora followed with breakfast and dinner(inclusive in entry ticket) is a bit unprofessional for any world heritage site. No one should force for such combo ticket by which ticket cost shoots up(475,000 IRD per head). Like day?
Prambanan: Similar to Borobudur, the admission ticket is expensive. This is a large hindu temple with 1 main structure, and several smaller ones inside the "park". We were for sunset, and was able to witness the red ball of fire setting in 2minutes or so. recommend to stay around for a?
Sultan: The place is beautiful but unfortunately the fountain was turned off. Still the surrounding is very nice and absolutely worth a visit if you also plan to visit the Sultan Palace.
Malioboro: After reading about Yogyakarta, I found that a lot of tourist activity seemed to revolve around Malioboro road in the heart of Yogyakarta. There were tourist attractions nearby so I thought this must be the place to stay. I was not disappointed.  The road is a one-way street.?
Artotel: I stayed with my family in this hotel last week and we are all very satisfied with our stay. This hotel is a instagrammable hotel. many art work could be find all over the hotel. Nice hotel and great location<U+0001F44D>
Grand: A new modern strategic hotel in town. Nearby Ambarukmo Plaza and street food. All facilities was family friendly and all staff also . We were helped by staff name Bima and new trainee to open all our wrapped baggage because we just landed. Breakfast at Samara restaurant was amazing , all food was delicious and the variety were too much from local traditional until continental. We were greeted by a staff named Sanni a nove and humble person very helpful an really complete-ing out vacation to be perfect.
Yogyakarta: Excellent associates,friendly also super polite. The hotel is located next to shopping mall. Great room, breakfast buffet is very diverse. Yudha at the Concierge is very attentive, helpful and looked into details in assisting for ground transfers, some routes, local & traditional entertainment & restaurants.

Borobudur: The heritage site is incredible and the energy palpible. It was still quite hot after three in the afternoon. I noticed there is access to the disabled but that is just up to the structure. If you are fit it is worth the climb to the top of the stupa. A must see for anyone?
Prambanan: Spectacular! The majestic temples at Prambanan are beautiful and awe-inspiring. The temples are architectural marvels, with the unique advantage of being huge as well as intricate. Gives you a unique insight into the cultural heritage of ancient times. A must on any tour of the?
Sultan: Not really explained nor indicated. It is a pity, as the castle is nice. But I had the feeling I was missing out on loads.
Malioboro: When you go there, you need to know what to expect. It is like 997263729 shops will all the same stuff, nothing special really. If you look western, everyone will try to get you into a conversation which is obviously aimed at you paying exorbitant amounts for some "artwork".?
Artotel: Nice hotel with artsy design, great location, easy to find many kind of food around hotel,   easy access from / to train station, comfy bed, nice breakfast, nice room ,and our kids love the slide in M floor.
Grand: This hotel was recommended to us by our friends. We felt very welcomed there. A very nice and careful personal. An excellent 5* hotel with a personal touch and family atmosphere. We very much enjoyed our stay there. It will be definitely our first choice if we travel again to Yogyakarta.
Yogyakarta: Good to be back and always happy when met all the peoples in Yogyakarta Marriott Hotel. All the staff are all the stellar! Room, food and all the facilities could bring you to the next step of great stay. One of the best marriott hotel in Asia, overall experience, more than satisfied.  Thank you Yogyakarta Marriott Hotel

Borobudur: Visitors going to Borobudur and Parambanan can buy the tickets for the 2 attraction together or separately. It is slightly cheaper to buy it together. It cost us $63 per pax which is only slightly cheaper than the price for Universal Studios Singapore.  We hired a vehicle for 4 ?
Prambanan: So many temples in Yogyakarta. So many history were born from there. And the one of hindu temple is Candi Prambanan. Looked so beautiful,wide places eventhough feels arid
Sultan: This is the nearest attraction to our hotel so we visited. It was ok but it is not a must see. A good glimpse of the javanese history but you will not learn anything as there is no explanation posted anywhere.
Malioboro: I was there for spending Saturday nite with my beloved, and found the area is very crowded. We enjoy walking around and tasted many kind of streed food
Artotel: Check in/out procedure is simple and fast. Bed room  is clean, good lighting, bathroom is clean also.  Breakfast: some food not warm, like sausages, potato wedges.  Table able not cleaned properly. Other food is ok.  Location is good, surrounded by many restaurants & cafes
Grand: Service: Staff are friendly, very attentive to your needs and always ready to help. For travellers who can only speak English - the staff here can understand and speak English very well. (Specific thanks to Winanda, Sandro and Sylvia for the help during my stay!)  Faciities: Hotel gym is well-equipped. Breakfast buffet is nice and has a wide selection.
Yogyakarta: I went to Yogyakarta for business purpose. I feel satisfied staying at Yogyakarta Marriot hotel. The room was ready before checkin time. It has beautifull infinity pool and good gym. The room was spacious with nice design. If you feel bore just walk to hartono mall.

Borobudur: Love the tour of the temple. We had an English speaking guide with us and he explained the history of the temple really well
Prambanan: It is a great place to visit. Highly recommended. The ticket is expensive Rp 350000 which I did not expect but it is like this and hopefully they accept card. There are also two more temples inside.They also have package for visiting the temples which is worth buying. Do not miss?
Sultan: It used to be a palace for the sultan of yogyakarta...  Lots of things you can find here, such as a undergorund tunnel, bunker, etc...  Some place was too spooky to be entered... but it?s cool  Nice place...  Come here at 9 am, not so many people in the morning...  Extra charge?
Malioboro: Malioboro road / street is always bustling with the various street food and shopping options available. If you are in Indonesia and want to buy some mementos for friends and family back home, this is your best bet. Its reasonable and the stuff is great. Tip: the multi-storey?
Artotel: We stayed with a friend who booked for us two rooms. Very funky interesting place, but we were two people in the room and only one pair of slippers were given and there was no hair dryer. We were requested to settle the room charge upon checking in but no receipt was provided and no correct change (IDR 500 is not much but it?s not about the amount, the correct change should be given to guest).
Grand: Spending my new year 2019 with my family at this hotel was a great choice!, I spend 3 days 2 night from 30 Dec 2018 to 1st January 2019, excellent service, good food and good standard of hotel!. surely i will come and stay this hotel again!. highly recommended.
Yogyakarta: Staying at this hotel is one of the most memorable stays my wife and I have ever had. My wife and I did not have much expectation seeing how it was a category 2 Marriott hotel but wow did it blow us away.   We have stayed at some luxury collection hotels but the service we received at this hotel supercedes in comparison to any other hotel we have stayed at. From the staff that assisted is in checking in, cleaning the rooms, assisting us in the lounge, and also in the kitchen every single person was genuinely kind and eager to help.   We had no issues with food eventhough we were vegetarian. The kitchen staff went above and beyond to make sure we were well taken care of due to our dietary restrcitons. For example, in the lounge the chef, Anastasia, was always available to give us?

Borobudur: It was neat to see these grand monuments, but I wish I had done more research and had known there are elephants&animals on display/caged up at both temples. This is unnecessary. It would have greatly affected my decision in going there. It was around 600k to do both Borobudur?
Prambanan: Prambanan Temples are a UNESCO World Heritage sight. The Hindu Temples were built in the 9th Century and are dedicated to Trimurti and include Brahma( the creator), Vishnu (the preserver), and Shiva (the destroyer). The Temples are 18km from the centre of Yogyakarta and there?
Sultan: This place is one destination to know Yogya is culture specially Sultan is daily activities. This water castle was for the family of Yogya is Sulthan
Malioboro: Old dilapidated buildings, dirty streets, too many street vendors begging to sell you stuff you do not need.. definitely a place to avoid!!
Artotel: This hotel can be a good destination while on Yogyakarta. Me and my husband stayed 1 night in this hotel (studio 23).Room is clean and comfortable, but poorly you can heard voices from next room :( ). The breakfast is good (they have varied breakfast menu !). The location is very good, near from everywhere (there are many restaurant around this hotel). This hotel have a artsy design so you can take a photo with art background :). They also have the slide (connecting the 2nd floor to the lobby), its very attractive for children.
Grand: I booked 4 rooms for 4 night (family holiday), asking 2 weeks earlier to get a connecting room/adjoining room because there will be a children is and elderly, when we arrive, we get 4 different rooms that not connected and separated crossed the hallway, and when my family gets busy going in and out to another room to find some of their stuff or talking with other family members, the hotel send their 3 staff and warn us because they think we are being too noisy...what are you expecting when you separate a family like that? - Buffet breakfast food - taste is so-so and you might need to wait before able to enter the restaurant because they are full capacity (no ETA, so wait until some seat available) - in room 609, the bathroom is smelly, calling their front-desk and their staff?
Yogyakarta: The Marriott Yogyakarta is an outstanding hotel in a very interesting city. The rooms are new, up to date,  and very comfortable. The pool and exercise area are spacious, well designed, and meticulously maintained. The hotel also is well situated to have easy access to the city. However, what really separates this hotel from others is the staff. In my 40 years of travel I have never encountered such a welcoming, attentive and professional staff. Whether it be at the front desk, either of the 2 restaurants on site, laundry service or pool/exercise area everyone was professional and there to help. In the restaurants the food was some of the best we encountered in all of Yogyakarta. Additionally, staff including Uji, Putri and Jared are truly exceptional individuals who went out of?

Borobudur: After seeing borobudur and we decided to go to the parking area, the security forced visitors to walk through the souvenir market. There should be free options for the visitors if they want to go to the souvenir market or not.
Prambanan: The history of hinduism in this area of the world can be felt here. The intricate designs of the temples, the east-west orientation and the proximity of the temple complex to the volcano is somehow all interlinked. The temple was, unfortunately, built on earthquake-prone land.?
Sultan: It is 15k each to get in here and there are some nice spots near the water.  However, the rest of the castle is just empty rooms with no explanation - perhaps the guides you can hire would add more. The additional tunnels near by add a little more to this attraction. Ok overall.
Malioboro: Love it or loathe it.  Not everyones idea of fun.  Malioboro is like Oxford Street in London the weekend before Christmas.  It is positively heaving.   So, if you love a busy downtown area with zillions of people doing street food and merchandise - then you will love it.  Equally,?
Artotel: Pros : + Cheap 4 stars in the area + Good Breakfast options + Free Wifi (though the speed is not stable) + Cappucino Machine in-room (but no Instruction)  Cons : - My main complain is the late night clubbing event, even it is not weekend !!!  I was told during check-in that there will be "music event" from 6pm until midnight. But it did not finish until 2.30am ! And the sound could be heard even from the 6th floor. So there, I lost my much needed sleep, before my important whole-day meetings !  - Air Con is way underpowered, it can only reach cold temperature between 7pm to 8am.   When there is a good amount of sunshine, the room is very warm.  - Bed Sheet and Towel is not completely clean, noticeably smear of footwear / makeup.  - Egg Station does not have any typical toppings?
Grand: My husband and I visited the hotel for 4 nights in mid December and had a wonderful stay. The hotel staff really couldn?t do enough for you, particularly Sylvia who gave us a delicious cake one afternoon!  The hotel rooms were of a good size and clean, whilst all other amenities (pool, gym, breakfast etc) were also very good.  Our only learning was that the hotel isn?t really in the centre so the only thing you can walk to is the shopping mall opposite and a few restaurants, but no real tourist spots, but that wasn?t an issue for us as it would have taken an extra 20 mins to get in and out of the centre to see the main attractions.  If we are in Yogyakarta again we will definitely stay here!
Yogyakarta: I enevr stayed in Marriott Yogya, but I had a few meetings there. The coffee break is good, but the pastry was not that good. The dinner is awesome, luxury thing that you can afford. The banquet staff were not that friendly but I do not really care, as long as the meeting room is nice and cool.

Borobudur: Amazing ! Wasn?t happy about seeing elephants chained up without water in there play area, was a sour note get rid of the elephants into the wild and don?t ruin people?s day it?s not nice to see they charge 20 usd entry and can?t even fill the elephants water up.
Prambanan: Amazing temple, of course it is a must see. I reccomend to hire a local guide who will explain a lot of thing. We managed to visit it at sunset time and it was magnificent. An Umbrella festival (how interesting) was taking place at the time of our visit.
Sultan: A nice royal pool from the past. But unfortunately too many visitors at july, when the school holiday is on. Not really enjoy my moments there
Malioboro: Since the goverment make everything there more tidy, i enjoy walking in malioboro. So comfortable, clean, nice..
Artotel: This hotel is suitable with its name Artotel.  Very artsy design, minimalist and yet comfortable.  Located in Kaliurang Street, easy access to go to train station and other main attractions.  I love their slide bar where you can find a brass slide, I mean for real, you can take a blanket and slide down to lobby area. Very playful and cute. Brilliant.  Staff are friendly. Room is clean and comfy.   I give <U+0001F44D><U+0001F44D> for this hotel.
Grand: This is my first time go to yogyakarta,very kind people and also the hotel clean and nice one,we try lounge to birthday party our friend,even trouble in first but the staff very awesome to make our night so happy
Yogyakarta: Stayed over 1 night at this Marriott, a great base to explore the city. The hotel is connected to Hartono Mall, which I think is the best mall in Yogyakarta currently. The hotel is truly modern and up to par with the newer Marriott hotels overseas. Check in was swift & friendly. We were given a room on the 2nd floor right beside their infinity pool. The room is spacious and love the design & color tone of the room. Bathroom is spacious as well & comes with shower only. Breakfast buffet has great selections of food and nice ambiance. But the most outstanding thing about the hotel is the staff, their staffs are very attentive, friendly without being to obtrusive. Truly 5 star!

Borobudur: Borobudur is a UNESCO protected monument. A Buddhist temple that is so much more than stone.  The temple is a grand structure that is a testament to humanity. The ability to construct the temple is awe inspiring, the spiritual atmosphere is humbling and the story of human?
Prambanan: Wonderful performance... too good to miss. The music is haunting and soothing, the costumes beautiful and the dancers so nimble. Some humorous segments too. Bring a light jacket as the breeze can be chilly at night.
Sultan: This is the palace before where the king live. Taman sari itself is where king and queen and  iselir  and daughters take a bath it has 3 pool which all of them has a different usage. Go and check it out.
Malioboro: Malioboro is the name of a straight road to the Sultan is palace of Yogyakarta. The road has become very popular because it is always crowded with domestic and foreign tourists, so that on both sides of this road many various displays are displayed, whether clothes, paintings,?
Artotel: Ive frequent stay at Artotel because of their good services and friendly staff. I just happened to have a tiring day and wanted to have a good rest in the hotel. Ive noticed somewhat loud noises and stuff which shouldnt happen but i tried to deal with it and think positively maybe theres construction nearby. Then i just found out this morning right above the bed, this big hole and spider web on the corner. Noticed some stain on the bedsheet (hoping its only laundry problems not because they dont clean the bedsheet at all<U+0001F91E>) Overall, still thinking that Artotel is a good hotel but hoping the management improvement especially in cleanliness details.
Grand: We book this hotel initially for 1 night. At the first night I went to the cake store at ground floor to buy red velvet cake. Out of curiosity, I ask the waiter (miss Dea) if they have any gluten free cake. Well they didn?t have it, but they willing to make it.  We were surprised that miss Dea made the cake that very night and gave it to my son in the morning.  We?re so touched by the gesture and decided to extend our stay for another 2 nights. It was never happened before. Oh and for other services, the luxurious room, the soft bed, swimming pool, the oxtail soup (oh my god!), all of them are top notch. Surely will be back here for longer stay.
Yogyakarta: It was a super nice hotel with super nice people I had while staying here. The location is super nice (right next to Hartono Mall). The pool is super wide and best to enjoy sunset.  The room is super grande! I order for twin bed, even fit for 4 person :p the bathroom super nice and relaxing.  The breakfast? I cant complain, best one! The staff are super nice and make sure I was happy and full lol.

Borobudur: Highly recommend to go for the sunrise tour of Borobudur Temple with the package provided by the Manohara Hotel, the atmosphere and the views were amazing. I traveled with a family of four, with my 2 parents who are ~60 years old. The steps were a bit steep but there were much?
Prambanan: Definitely worth the time and effort to visit. I visited as part of a private tour with driver and also went to the Ramayana Ballet afterwards plus there is a tasty Indonesian buffet on site.  The temples are sublime and set in their own park with other activities laid on.  I?
Sultan: We were lucky and we had the chance to discover it with Regina, an apprentice guide, who explained us many things about the building! Fascinating building!!
Malioboro: Batik is everywhere. My head ached from too much batik products. They got everything for men, women and children. At cheap to expensive. Do your souvenir shopping here and of you will buy in the streets, bargain.
Artotel: Me, my husband, and my parents stayed for 2night at Artotel Yogyakarta. We booked 2 23rooms with bfast with a very good deals. At first, i afraid this hotel will be a little bit complicated for my parent. But they end up enjoy it the most. The staffs were helpfull. Lobby?s hotel was very unique with some art things and a slide from one floor above. My husband loves it. The rooms was simple, clean, cozy, aircon works good. The best one is the bed. Oh i hope i could bring it home with me. The bathroom was a bit small but water pressure is very good. Another good points is the location. There are a lot attractions and food culinaries around the hotel. The cons are the breakfast, no taste at all for me, but the variations was good enough. And the room itself isn?t too soundproof.?
Grand: i know this hotel from my office mate, then i try this hotel for my buss trip and its awesome, new hotel, great place, great room, great staff include mba chandra when i have my breakfast, she was very nice and polite. i will come back again to stay here
Yogyakarta: The Jogja Marriott hotel lived up to our  high expectations of a Marriott brand. The hote has a large and impressive entrance. The check-in staff was very polite and efficient. We had booked multiple rooms and they gave us connecting rooms for our families which made a huge difference to us. The check-in experience  clued us into the wonderful service we were going to experience during our stay.  We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and the service at the hotel, without exception, was excellent. Whenever we made any requests of the staff they went out of their way to satisfy them. The hotel staff made us feel special. The concierge staff helped us with our tours and travels around Jogja and those arrangements were top notch.  Our rooms overlooked the beautiful hotel pool. The?

Borobudur: Temple is impressive, and was wonderful to see huge...... but millions of people, street vendors in your face at every step but not allowed inside so when walking the grounds only need to contend with the other tourist. Albeit as one only 3 westerners we saw there we were?

Sultan: Nice castle in a really interesting neighborhood in Yogyakarta.  Not to be missed! Plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby.
Malioboro: This place reminds me of some of the really great street shopping alleys I have seen in different parts of Asia.  I have to say the best thing about this street are the Batik shoppes which has some of the nicest prints and designs with the lowest prices. I think I got myself 3?
Artotel: We reserved by phone at 3 pm and arrived at 11 pm in d same day, so easy, fast m they gave us great hospitality <U+0001F44D><U+0001F3FB>  Good location in d central, enough parking lot with d valet, but my suggestion: be ready in d front lobby.  Studio 25 is comfortable for family w kids. My son 2 y o was slept, suddenly awake and smile coz see d wall painting interior. Nice! He likes it.  Each floor has different theme made by different artist. We were in 3 n really wanna try d other floor.  Good variety of breakfast n great waitress. My son was try to find another watermelon and one of them find out in d kitchen n served us. Thanks!   Slide for adult! And also d bamboo seat in d lobby, must try! Soo unique and fun!
Grand: I stayed in this hotel for 8 nights with my family. We stayed in the Deluxe King room. The room was on level 5, which was great for us as it was the same level as the gym and the pool. It was not noisy at all. The room was kept clean daily. One of my grouse was that the towels were not replaced after being taken away for the first 2-3 days, and we had to call Housekeeping to remind them. After that, it was ok.  The gym was good and functional. Room service was great too. Food selection was wide and quality was good. The breakfast buffet range was sufficiently wide. The staff were all warm and courteous. One of the perks of staying here for us was its close proximity to the Plaza Ambarrukmo mall and the hotel has an on-demand shuttle to and fro. This suits our schedule perfectly.?
Yogyakarta: This is our third stay at the Marriott Yogyakarta and have nothing but praise to write.  It seems each visit the hotel simply gets even better.  The hotel is strategically located beside the gigantic Hartono Mall that makes shopping an appreciated convenience.  The center of town is approximately a 15-20 minute drive depending on traffic.  All the staff, from front desk, lobby entrance, restaurant, housekeeping, security are polite, friendly, and always willing to provide assistance.  The rooms are very modern, spacious, and immaculately clean.  The bathrooms are contemporary with beautiful marble floors and modern sliding doors.  Our room overlooked a large swimming pool. Breakfast is a lavish smorgasbord of foods from Indonesian, other southeast Asian, to Western specialties?

Borobudur: This is a sprawling temple complex that needs a guide to best understand the long history of the complex. Once lost now found and its a sight to behold with an incredible history. Climb up the steps of the square foundational portion to the round upper perfection levels. Peer?
Prambanan: Beautiful and very colorful costumes.  The  Prambanan temples provided a nice back drop for the venue.
Sultan: Ok to visit. Expected a little more. It takes about 20 in to visit the whole place. I reccomend for a quick visit.
Malioboro: If you are looking for some bargains especially batiks and handicrafts, Malioboro Road is the place to be. The best time to go is in the day where you can browse and bargain at your leisure. Come evening, this place is packed; like practically the only place to be at night! ?
Artotel: located at the busy road, nearby to university, surrounded by convenience stores, cafe, resto, cofffee spot. hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.  nice artistic touch from hotel lobby  till bathroom inside room. clean, tidy, value for money.
Grand: When we arrived at the hotel from the airport later then expected, we were immediately welcomed by the nice bellboys and security who helped my dad getting out of the car (he can?t walk without help), also with the luggage. Check-in was quick and efficient, the guy at reception was super friendly and helpful. Then we were shown to our adjoining rooms for our two night stay and I was glad to see that the rooms were exactly like the pictures. The rooms were big, comfortable and luxurious. All the amenities were available in the bedroom and bathroom.  The beds were heaven, we just arrived from Thailand and the beds are super hard. So this was like sleeping on a cloud, the pillows were absolutely Devine! I had the best sleep during my four week holiday, it?ll be hard to top.  The?
Yogyakarta: The staff tried its best to accommodate our requests (upgrade for Marriott Platinum guest for example) and was extremely polite throughout our stay. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was fantastic.

Borobudur: It is a stunning place, 1200 years old and still incredibly detailed reliefs and statues that describe ancient Javanese society and religious beliefs. Do not just go up to the stupas but spend some time circling the lower galleries and study the reliefs as well. In public?

I was going to give a 4 star reviews, however I decided to take out one star. Grand: excelent service, perfect hotel to stay so far  try to see arcadaz, one of the employee Dini i belived her name super welcome. would definetely come back to this hotel. keep up the good work grand ambarrukmo
Yogyakarta: This is my first visit to Yogjakarta and I chose to stay at the Marriott here. The hotel is celebrating its second anniversary so it is fairly new. The biggest standout for me is the friendliest staff I have ever encountered in all the Marriott properties I have stayed to date. Nothing is too much trouble and they remembered our names... the drinks that we like and ever so attentive.  The room is spacious and comfortable. The bath tub is enormous and one could enjoy a bath while enjoying the sunset!  Food at the kitchen is average and probably can be improved upon but the choices is plentiful.  The Quan Spa is very good. Marriott members get discount of 10% to 20%, depending on the category of membership.   I enjoyed my stay very much and would highly recommend it.

Borobudur: A bit crowded at sunrise at the top level. But spend some time after the sun comes up to explore the other levels with a guide.

Yogyakarta: I thing this hotel is The best and newest hotel in jogja right now. I live with family in this hotel and we like it,our room is big enough,the breakfast is good,the swimming pool is good..not far from the airport too

Borobudur: Very crowded during the holiday season. The good thing, they opened additional parking and entrance aside from the main gate. Just look for ?West Parking,? which was a local soccer field that converted into parking lots.

Artotel: Been stayed in here for 2 nights with my loved, everything was sooo perfect.. Grand: Hotel is conveniently within 20mins (off peak) of the International Airport and across the road from a very large modern Plaza Ambarrukmo shopping mall. To make it even sweeter, they were really kind enough to decorate our room with a romantic setting for our wedding anniversary.  All the staffs, from front desk, lobby entrance, restaurant, housekeeping, security and swimming pool staffs were really polite and friendly, always with a smile on their faces. Room was clean and spacious with a very modern?
