Grand: I come from jakarta , and I try grand ambarrukmo to stay because room so clean and very comfortable . Actually this is my 2x visit . So before back to jakarta , I choose this lounge for dinner and get some drink . The staff very nice and humble feel like home . Thankyou Dini , Marga , Doni . My last day in jogja very awesome <U+0001F44D><U+0001F44D>
Yogyakarta: Everything superb here, from check in, FnB, Rooms, Gym, Pool.. for sure will comeback again here.  All the staff are well educated and friendly. Breakfast menu are too much variety and all food are delish tasty. Keep up ur good work all. Thumbs up!!!!

Borobudur: Too many tourists at certain timings... But I enjoyed looking at the structure and just observing the environment. I think we dont need a guide here and it is pretty easy to walk around.
Prambanan: This temple is not heavily advertised and is overshadowed by its counterpart in Borobudur.   By itself, this Temple is a Wonder of the World in itself.  Most of the temple complex has been preserved, with the complex having atleast five temple.  One each dedicated to Brahma,?
Sultan: Nothing interesting. The colour of the water was greenish. There?s a spot good for taking photos where all the steps are linked together. The place was under construction and there wasn?t really much to see. Was done with it in less than 15 minutes.
Malioboro: The place is massive with countless stalls selling more or less the same range of goods. Cheap printed Batik, souvenir, simple toys for kids. Too commercialise. Not really worth visiting. Maybe you can find some cheap Batik bags to bring back as souvenir.
Artotel: It was located on the busiest road at Jogja, but easy to find various food. The room was cute and I could not thank enough for the great coffee machine. Need some improvement on where they put the furniture --> big TV was located above the desk which made me unable to did some work.
Grand: I stayed here for business for 3 nights-Rooms are good size, clean, and  well equipped. Air conditioning excellent, WiFi excellent, Bathroom excellent.Electric sockets by the bed to charge phone etc. Good size swimming pool, small gym, but functional. To top a long day traveling- I had the delight of eating at "The Samara Restaurant on the ground floor. The staff ( Mr Adi & Ms Silvia are attentive, super friendly and polite-always smiling :-) great service!
Yogyakarta: We stayed here for a week and were sad we were leaving. The hotel has a friendly and personal approach which makes you feel really welcome. The restaurant has amazing food and the staff makes sure you get full service. A special thanks to staff members Havidz (restaurant) and the people from the front desk. You are very professional and know what hospitality is all about. Good job !  The rooms are beautiful and clean.  We will for sure book this hotel again when we come back to Yogja.  Terima kasih banyak !

Borobudur: get a great guide (ours had been there more than 2000 times), drive the back way (through the countryside) and spend some time.  if you can get there at sunset and here the call to prayer from all the small mosques around it will be even better
Prambanan: Prambanan Temple is an excellent place for a visitor.  The temple compound is open and extensive.  The UNESCO world heritage site is must visit when in Yogyakarta.  Unless here on business or family , I would imagine you are likely to be here for Yogyakartas rich historic past -?
Sultan: Under renovation, in very poor condition, nothing to see. We did not understand why we need to buy entrance ticket to see nothing
Malioboro: We went there at night.It was very crowded. I almost got lost. It was very hard to walk. We had to be careful. Almost everything was sold there. We didn?t had time to buy anything because it was too crowded.
Artotel: It was great to stay at Hotel Artotel. Great room, clean, comfy, and good breakfast. Very easy to get there. The hotel is very artistic and hommy. I very recommend to my colleagues and family to stay at this hotel. Thank you for the hospitality
Grand: Its at a good location near the Ambarrukmo Mall and right on Adisucipto street with its many food and shopping options.   The rooms were exceptionally comfy and clean. Lighting was adequate in the room and facilities were excellent.   The staffs were all friendly and gave warm smile each time we meet them at the lift lobby, main lobby and driveway. Felt like coming home. The breakfast was great! There is a wide selection of local Indonesian fare which we liked. Staffs at the restaurant like Andhy and another young lady were kind enough to recommend several local food for us to try.   Overall we had an excellent experience in this hotel. Will definitely stay here again the next time we visit Jogja.
Yogyakarta: We have visit many hotels in Indonesia but a hotel with this kind of service is unique. The staff of this hotel is so well trained that they know exactly what you want to be treated. My compliments goes specially to Havidz from the breakfast and Hadi from the gym and swimming pool. They did a really great job and in hope that the hotel management give them also credits for doing a great job to give the guests a great feeling. I want to thank the guy from the front desk that help us to booked a room for my friend from Yogyakarta to feel the same experience.  For al the people in the world who are looking for a great hotel in Yogyakarta, don?t look further you find the place to be.

Borobudur: This temple is by far the most beautiful in the central Java region. You cannot come to Yogyakarta without visiting this temple (ideally during sunrise). Ensure you walk around each of the seven layers as there are hidden surprises along the way that you can only notice at eye?
Prambanan: What an amazing place. It takes your breath away. Looks fake like a background  Hired push bikes to see the other small temples which was fun. Well worth it
Sultan: Water castle was under renovation during our visit so it was messy. We only walked around a small section of the castle. Place was not well maintained with paint peeling off, etc. The rooms are mostly empty. Only 1 room has a "bed" which is just some wooden planks put together.
Malioboro: Very crowded, mainly with locals. Selling almost the same stuffs everywhere. Prices are cheap though if you are looking for local Brand?s apparels and T-shirts. Can also try their horse ride which is quite unique.
Artotel: If you get wasted then it suit you well,but i bring my family and a baby so i recommend you to find another place to stay. Thin wall,you can heard someone coughing from next room,different information between the FO girl and the laundry man.
Grand: Best sleep so far in the normal room. The check in was easy and smooth, the staff already prepared with paperwork and we just had to fill in some columns.   Room was massive and beautiful. Bathroom was large and very clean with nice adjustable water pressure.   Our favourite part was the breakfast time, with a large selection of food, very tasty for big bulk of food. Staff was very helpful. I wanted vanilla ice cream on my pancakes, i requested it to one of the staff and 5 mins later it?s already on my table. Will definitely stay in this hotel again if i ever visit Jogja in the near future.
Yogyakarta: We booked the club room for 3 nights when attending a family wedding. We were excited that it is located next to a shopping mall as we have a toddler traveling with us. The room is very nice, very modern styled, bathroom is super spacious. The pool is also nice for adults and kids although it could use more greeneries. It is a very new hotel so maybe that why the do not have enough big trees yet. We had a hard time rinsing off after a pool time cause we had to walk all the way to their gym toilet to get changed and shower. The AC is very cold, not suitable for trying to get little children cleaned up after a swim. We did not see any outdoor shower near the pool. No kids club so you will need to get to the mall for kids entertainment. The hotel is more for business type guests I?

Borobudur: Although much younger in age, compared to the Egyptian Piramids, Borobudur Temple is the largest Buddhist heritage in the world. It is well recommended to intensively do a lot of research or browsing, in order to understand the history, all the meanings of this temple. And?
Prambanan: Definitely worth the visit. Did this for sunset and Borobudur for sunrise. You can get a combined pass and use it over two days if you want. Beautiful temples. Worth the price.
Sultan: When we visited (in April), there was no water as the place seems to be under renovation. Not worth visiting till the renovation is completed.
Malioboro: We were there in a week after Hari raya, and it was really crowded but it was fun walking in a wide pedestrian walk with so many people enjoying their time. There are so many benches and decorative rock that you can sit on if you were tired. So many food vendors where you can?
Artotel: For clean, friendly and tastefully designed hotel, this is the place to go. Near to many eateries and short ride to Ambrukmo Plaza. Airport is about 30 mins by car (depends on timer and traffic), super convenient.
Grand: Hotel is new and clean, guestroom is spacious and comfy bed with good water pressure for shower, excellent service and very accommodate from the hotel staff, specially extending my greatest appreciation to Mr. Ditra, whom he was my driver from the hotel has given me a safe and relaxing one day tour excursion around Jogja.  And, there is a shopping mall right opposite the hotel.
Yogyakarta: Rooms are spacious, something that today is  hotels do not usually have. The Deluxe Room, the lead-in category messures 40m2. Once the sliding walls between the bedroom and bathroom are retracted, the room feels even more spacious. Meeting facilities are to note of this hotel. The ballroom seats 1,650 banquet style. Supporting the bathroom is 7 meeting rooms for smaller meetings. Another pride of the hotel is the event technology. The Marriott Meeting Service app allows service requests to be made in real time. Breakfast at The Yogyakarta Kitchen is very enjoyable. The buffet spread is lavish and delicious. I enjoyed spending time sitting at the breakfast table and tried different things on diferent days, Relaxing at the pools with kids or pamper yourself at the spa is recomended ?

Borobudur: We went at noon, and it was too hot. There was a marathon going on, so we need not hire a sarong to wear. While climbing up the steep stairs - thankfully hand rails were installed - was tiring, in my view, walking back in a circuitous manner to the car was tougher, since it was?
Prambanan: These Hindu temples are on a large site so give yourself enough time to visit each one. They are very well maintained and visually beautiful. Whilst very popular with loca;s and tourists, it does not feel crowded as there are so many to visit and enjoy. A MUST SEE attraction.
Sultan: Nothing special. If you find yourself with free time than go but you won?t miss anything by not going. The water is not on in the pools. The buildings look unkept. It?s small. The only worthwhile thing to see was the mosk.
Malioboro: very interesting place to visit in the city of Jogja.. one of the places that must be visited when visiting Yogyakarta... souvenirs are sold that can be used as souvenirs from the city of Jogja... Do not forget to take a photo at the zero kilometer point of the city of Jogja near?
Artotel: The third Artotel known in Indonesia, Artotel Yogyakarta presents the most artsy and interesting among the two before in Jakarta and Surabaya. You could easily spotted a cool slide and an artsy instalation inside the hotel. In their each room yet has a cool different paint and concept. And trust me, they had a super comfort pillows. The staff were nice. The hotel also has a pool, and a cafe named Roca. Definetely one of the most pleasant pick to stay.
Grand: Arcada Executive Lounge at Grand Ambarrukmo hotel is the right choice for us to do business with and assisted by a beautiful girl named Ockta Dini as a Guest Relations Officer (GRO) with the accompaniment of Jazz making our business communications that night reached a meeting point. thank you Arcadaz and thank you Octa Dini ... <U+0001F64F><U+0001F64F><U+0001F64F>
Yogyakarta: This hotel has to be the best business hotel in town. I have been there few times and each time was great. The room I was allocated was nice overlooking the pool - The service of the entire staff is great and they have a lot of attention to details to make you remembering your stay.

Borobudur: When is the next time you are going to be here? Get up at 4am, make the effort, see the mist lift from the valley, see the volcanoes against the papaya coloured sky. Or go later, when its hot and there are no shadows or play in the light. Up to you, but I would go at sunrise.?
Prambanan: We saw this Javanese dance drama of the Ramayana enacted in an airy and comfortable outdoor theatre. The dancing was superb and the accompanying music really high quality. They provide an information sheet so it is easy to follow the action. However, even if you miss some of the?
Sultan: This place well-known as Royal recreation park in the past. The Javanese architecture mix with Portuguese building. Now is open for public. In the main entrance you will the beautiful gate and several  buildings and in the second gate down you will find 3 pool. 1 large pool for?
Malioboro: The best tourist destination in Yogyakarta. The best time to visit is about late afternoon. The walk path is nice and easy to walk around
Artotel: Everything was just perfect! I strongly suggest to use the pick up service from airport to the hotel. Better service and for sure much better price than the overcharged official taxi at the airport.The location is so close to the places where you can get great foods. Will come back there for sure!
Grand: I stayed in this hotel for two nights for business purposes. I impressed with the hospitality of the hotel staffs. The front office staffs who assisted me in the checked out were also very helpful. The hotel room was very clean and modern. The hotel is situated relatively close to the airport. The only shortcomings from this hotel that I noticed was its narrow entry for big cars or small buses.
Yogyakarta: Stay in this hotel for 3 days and Infound that tjisnhotelnis very nice, room are very comfortable and staff are very friendly.  The positive point of this hotel is attached to Hartono Mall where you can easily go for shopping. Airport Adisutjipto (JOG)!is just 20 mins by car.  Overall it was pleasant stay.

Borobudur: Must visit if visiting Indonesia. You can purchase a combined ticket for Borobudur and Prambanan temple for 630k which is really worth (Borobudur only is 350K). Visit early in the morning. However, the ticket offices open at 6am.   You can use public transport to and from?
Prambanan: It is quite similar to most of the ancient hindu temple i have seen in India. But the carving had more details with many stories to tell and look impressive as a whole. Worth seeing and best do it together with borobudur to marvel the 7 and 8 century historical monuments. Get a?
Sultan: Well, as others write, a bit of a scam that they don?t mention at the ticket booth that it?s drained from water and under renovation now. Anyhow, we enjoyed it, especially by sneaking out on the backside and walking the small pathways out towards Bale Raos. That was a great?
Malioboro: This is not the shopping place it used to be. It?s very, very crowded. The city has tried to make pedestrian traffic easier by reclaiming part of the road, but these sections have no sun protection. Everyone crowds into the narrow shaded sections. The plethora of stalls only?
Artotel: I had a great time staying at artotel Yogyakarta.The room was clean, food was good, staffs were friendly.Easy access to everywhere.There?s lots of options of food around the hotel, but there?s also 24 hours restaurant at the hotel if you decide to stay in.I would definitely be coming back here.
Grand: Second stay in this hotel and always super satisfied. Room were spacious, clean with super comfotable bed. Food was great with excellent service from the restaurant staff, especially by Mba Diah who assisted me during breakfast. Feeling homy by friendly staff. Always be my first hotel option in Jogja.
Yogyakarta: Fantastic hotel. We stayed at the junior suite. Next to big shopping centre so plenty of food options and the buffet breakfast was sensational.  Would have given the hotel 5/5 had they not had the silly policy set by the manager of not letting my child into the Marriot Club. Thankfully, we had a sales consultant from Ritz Carlton help us sort this out.

Borobudur: Wow so much to see and take in, best to go for sunrise. If your interested in wildlife as well as historic sites, watch out for swiftlets starting their daytime activities catching inspects and bats arriving back at the temple at dawn to slip between the tiles and stonework.?
Prambanan: You have to admir ancestors  wisdom  and creativity. the story on the wall is very interesting and I would suggest you hire a guide. Ticket is a little expensive considering local PPP, however it worths! You can buy combination ticket of here and Borobudur.
Sultan: I have visited this place in 2001 for the first time, in 2019 for the second time. Renovation works 18 years ago, renovation works now, you expect to se a pool filled with water, as the name suggest, you will se an empty pool with workers instead. The whole place is very bad?
Malioboro: Around one km long road full of wonderful arts, horse carriages, handcrafts, batik (hand painted) cloths and clothing stores.
Artotel: This hotel was almost 1 year old - open their door on dec 2017, when i stayed last november (was there after Borobudur Marathon). the location was great - in jalan kaliurang - easy access to the other part of the city via ring road utara, and UGM access road. their room is clean and artisty - i think its one of bigger room compare to other artotel props :)) breakfast is properly served with plenty of options (include a action station), and they also have an accoustic live music performances. staff is great..blend of Javanese hospitality and modern artotel service approach.  definitely will come back on my next visit
Grand: Arrived at thir property from outside of Jogjakarta. Check in was fast and very welcoming by the receptionist. Room size is big enough and very quiet, too. Cleanliness is really satisfactory since the property is still new. Food options for breakfast were also good.
Yogyakarta: Everything is PERFECT! From the day we check in to check out, the staffs were very courteous. Customer service was superb for all, thanks to Daniel he was very helpfull and nice. The room is very comfy, the house keeping boy Alvian he?s so polite and very friendly. Breakfast was AWESOME. Swimming pool was great. We will definitely come again during our trip to Yogya and from now on will be our regular hotel to stay whenever we visit Yogya. Keep up the good work! Thank you so much Yogyakarta Marriott Hotel. It was splendid experience for us.

Borobudur: This temple has been well preserved, especially the numbers of carvings on it. It is a pleasing symmetrical shape and stands out nicely against the jungle around. Whilst we were there, there were lots of groups of schoolchildren and clearly this temple is rated by the locals,?
Prambanan: I?m repeating others here but the temples were just beautiful! Stunning and peaceful. Worth a visit, I think. However, I can?t give it 5 stars. There are a few factors; firstly, the appalling cages filled with ill and unhealthy looking rabbits, goats and deer were so upsetting.?
Sultan: The site is under construction  No water at all  Tatally disappointing!  A lot of people as we go there during public holiday
Malioboro: A bustling street full of people trying to sell you the local batik silk cloth. A few small shopping mall and street food. Nothing much to see or be excited about. But it?s one of the Main Street in Yogyakarta so you might want to check it out simply to tick it off your list.?
Artotel: Having good exoerience stayed in this hotel. Love the room decoration. Enjoy the cleaniness. Great location near the UGM campus , restaurant and also buy "oleh oleh" .  Service was really good. I will be back in my next visit to Yogya
Grand: We slept at this hotel for two days and it was so amazing. The staff is really kind and helpful. The rooms are very beautiful, clean and comfortable. The kingsize bed is amazing!! We definitely recommend this hotel and we will make sure we visit again in the future. Special thanks to Andhy, Ryan and Shinta for the great service during dinner. Which was also very good, tastfull and not expensive.  Love from Holland!
Yogyakarta: What amazing value! For less than USD150 a night, you can upgrade to a club room which gives you access to the lounge where snacks and drinks (yes, even alcoholic ones!) are served through till 11.30pm. The rooms are clean and modern, and the twin bed configuration we booked was supremely roomy...you could fit a family with 2 adults and 2 young children easily. Location wise it is about 15-20 minutes away by car to the city centre, but slightly more peaceful as a consequence.   The breakfast buffet spread was exceptional - make sure to come hungry - and even the spa was not over priced by 5 star hotel standards. My only critique of this property would be the dim, white lighting in the lobby washrooms as it detracted from the luxurious feel that otherwise runs through the entire?

Borobudur: Recently visited the Borobudur with 3 other friends. We were blessed with an excellent tourist guide in Budi Setyo Lelono who was competent and obliging especially with his remarkable photo-taking skills. Understanding our mature age, Budi paced us up the various levels?
Prambanan: After visiting Borubudur at sunries last month, I must see the Prambanan temple on a sunset. We got there around 5PM and that was perfect. Not a lot of tourists and there was some sense of quiet around which is how I want to experience this moment.  As soon as the sun turns?
Sultan: I came to this place yesterday and this is the real scene. It is under construction, messy and crowded. Waste of 15k IDR ticket.
Malioboro: Almost all the shops in the street are same. They sell either batik or souvenirs. There are Polo Ralp Lauren is stores as well. There are a couple of malls too. This is a good place to spend a few hours.
Artotel: Definetely recommended hotel when you are visit Yogyakarta. Strategic location, nice ambience, great service, full of smile, feels like home! Quick check in & check out from the reception without any hustles. Very sincere when assisting the guest. You must try ROCA! Nice taste with generous portion, worth for the money!Love the room as well, however the bath towel a bit smells not good but its ok..not a big deal. Definetely will come back very soon.
Grand: After staying for one night we returned to the hotel a few days later for another two nights. Our first impressions during the first stay were reconfirmed during the second stay: this is a great hotel for business people, holiday makers and weekenders to feel comfortable and well cared for. It has not the grandeur and splendor of the Royal Ambarrukmo but through its design, the color scheme of brown and various shades of grey throughout, the hotel creates harmony and well being. The rooms are very comfortable and have a good size. Everything is available that you expect from a new four star hotel. The breakfast buffet is excellent in choice, presentation and quality of food, the restaurant pleasant and the service even though mostly by young waiters and waitresses fast, friendly?
Yogyakarta: I visited Yogyakarta Marriot hotel on 26 until 27 August 2019. I attended in seminar held by Bank Indonesia Central Bank of Indonesia). The location of this hotel near a very great and famous mall called Hartono Mall in a very strategic location. The service of the hotel is very excellent. The food in the restaurant is very delicious and high class. I recommend other people to stay at this hotel

Borobudur: This is an amazing temple complex that has been rebuilt after falling into disrepair for several hundred years.  (Yes, its that old...)  Great architecture that was obviously designed with Buddhist concepts at the forefront.  I recommend getting a guide so that you do not miss?
Prambanan: I decided to go to Prambanan temples to refresh my memory on the temples.  As a kid, almost every Indonesia have to go there, but it has been ages since I came here and I decided to go to the temples by myself.  I enjoyed the 2 hours stay at Prambanan temples.  1) Hire a bike; ?
Sultan: It is very nice old building which was built in about 1757. Very close to Sultan Palace about 200 meters behind. A good option after visiting Yogyakarta Sultan Palace.
Malioboro: Too crowded, especially in the evening.  One big market with majority of the stalls selling the same things. Otherwise quite colourful.
Artotel: Spacious room with unique design! Location also great, easily find food or shops near the hotel. Staffs were friendly, pool was great as well. Not to mention the slide from mezzanine to 1st floor, must try!
Grand: The hotel is not centrally located however is not far from the airport and a short taxi drive from the city center; it is close to many small restaurants and just in front of a mall with all facilities you might need including a big supermarket, coffees, ATMs and Currencies Change Office. The room we stayed was big and even with an additional bed for our son it was enough roomy; beds were comfy, bathroom with a big shower was well maintained and clean. Breakfast was very well displayed in the big restaurant, the quality of the food was very good with a fair variety (it is more Asian oriented than Western anyhow it caters to all tastes/needs). The swimming pool are is nice and big; also the fitness center is got for some work out and running on treadmills. The Staff at the front?
Yogyakarta: The Yogyakarta Marriott Hotel is a newer hotel, right next to an upscale shopping mall and about 15 or 20 minutes by car (depending on traffic) from the old airport.   Everything about the hotel is excellent. From the doormen to the front desk to the club lounge staff to the pool attendants to the housekeepers. The staff are some of the best staff I have ever encountered. Very professional and hospitable. When you ask for something or request a service you get it. There is no asking twice. Housekeepers keep your room exceptionally clean.    The gym and pool are very nice for a city hotel and are actually better than gyms and pools at some big resorts. My only complaint is the pool closes too early. It would be nice to swim at night, especially if you are in Yogyakarta for work?

Borobudur: Borobudur is an amazing temple. I proposes to reserve more time for this place. Temple  is extremely rich in details. Climbing the stairs at the prevailing temperature there are not easy.  because it is a place where I do not go back it is proposed to focus on it and stay there?
Prambanan: An excellent piece of history that must be seen whilst in Java (I would recommend with Borobudur).  We bought a joint ticket for both places at approx 630k each as international tourists - this allowed us to see Prambanan today and if we wished, Borobudur tomorrow. The site is?
Sultan: So many people, but okay place to visit. We went during repairs of the pool so unable to look at it beautifully
Malioboro: I stayed within walking distance to here and I find it is then convenient afer a trip to walk along the street, take in the sights and smells... find a nice place to eat or have a drink... maybe catch some street entertainment... and generally just take in the vibe of the city.
Artotel: The room is nice, clean, and spacious although the wall is quite thin and not soundproof so it might be getting noisy with the conversation and people moving things on the other room. And get quite loud on Sunday when there is a church service
Grand: They have not so big lobby but a very high ceiling with marble here and there. It is look like a 5 star hotel to me. The room also very nice and modern. I like the carpet in their room corridor. Look so art and lux. They have a lounge and a ballroom in the same floor with swimming pool view. Perfect for wedding or gathering event. I will surely recommend this hotel to my colleague.
Yogyakarta: Loved the facilities, very clean and modern. The buffet breakfast was amazing with so many choices. We loved our stay. The only detail why it was not perfect was due to the loud sounds from the nearby mosque that woke us up around 4 am but I guess this would be the case in almost all Yogya. If you are a light sleeper I would suggest bringing some ear plugs.

Borobudur: We left our hotel at Yogyakarta and left for Borobudur by an innova car . The journey took us one hour 30 minutes a distance of about 40 Kms . We bought the tickets from the cab is office for both borobudur and Prambanan temple at IDR 607500 ( INR 3200 USD 44) . It was hot?
Prambanan: Frankly speaking, I had no idea before I visited here.But I love there after I came. It was an old Indian temple area with large field in the midddle Java in Indosia. There are around 240 temples here including sound architecture or not. There are six main buildings in the field?
Sultan: I believe they are renovating - well overdue by the look of it. It should be closed as ponds are full of green slime, walls dripping with discolouration and really not worth any effort, let alone expense to see.
Malioboro: Been here many times and usually enjoy it, although it is much too crowded in many places. Good place to buy affordable and reasonable quality batik, as well as countless cheap clothing and touristy stuff. If you want to go the full tourist, you can get a horse and cart of becak?
Artotel: I like to decorations on every walls in the hotel.. make you feel relax and comfortable during the stay. excellence in smiles, uniforms, wifi connection, cleanliness of the hotel and rooms.. will return..
Grand: The service was beyond great, everyone is very friendly, and none of it is disappointing. They provide you variety of foods for breakfast, the pastry is exceptionally really good. I love it how they still stick to the heritage by providing you jamu as their welcome drink despite of how modern the hotel is. The restaurant is foods are all delicious as well. The location of the hotel is also great since you have a mall right in front of you. I had a great time staying here.
Yogyakarta: I stayed at Yogyakarta Marriott Hotel for two nights on August 2019 to experience the cultural city of Yogyakarta.  The location is a bit unfortunate as it is bit far from the tourism area such as Malioboro but It would be very great for business trip as it is easily accessed from the main line. It is connected to Hartono Mall which is very helpful for my case as I was forgot to bring socks and so I can get them easily at the H&M in Hartono Mall.  The room is modern, bedding is comfortable, linens are great, spacious and sparkling clean. bathroom feels luxurious with all the marble surfaces. Unfortunately we were unlucky as we got this no view room (we booked city view room) which is not what we expected and not what its advertised (see the picture) the views were blocked by?

Borobudur: To avoid large crowds, try to go for the sunset view of the temple as it offers a breathing taking view.
Prambanan: A beautiful place to visit and take some pictures. Even the markets close to the exit were nice to visit.
Sultan: My husband and I visited Tamansari expecting to see old but beautiful pools/bathing complex, but this was a ripoff! All we saw were men doing constructions and some rubbish around.   Ticket office didn?t even bother telling us the current situation of the place.  Don?t waste?
Malioboro: In my recent visit to yogyakarta,i stayed at budget hotel in sastrowojayan street,very near to malioboro street..so i visit malioboro street everynight to find nice food and buy some souveniers for friends and family.  In my opinion,if u want to visit this famous street better?
Artotel: Stayed at this hotel to end my trip to Jogja. Firstly, this hotel has lots of beautiful spots for your photo collections. Each floor showcases the work of a local artist. Staffs were mostly effective and lively. The breakfast is OK with some selections of dishes. The biggest downside of this hotel is on the property/ building itself: you can hear steps, people talking, people closing the door, etc; AC is not cold enough during the two days of my stay. I think the management need to find solutions for these things.     Stay 21-23 November 2018
Grand: The Hotel is not big but modern style and minimalist. Room: good, 31 mq, furnished as more higher than standard 4stars, big bathroom. Service: fast, good and no issue. Parking: enough  Pool: small Gym: Small Lounge: Small Price: in line as standard 4stars. Mall Ambarukmo in front, very easy to reach. Airconditioning: silence. Sales manager Ms Retno is very helpful. Recomended for short stays.
Yogyakarta: The hotel is modern, clean, and very appealing. The value received relative to the rate paid was outstanding. As Marriott platinum members we were upgraded to a very spacious seventh floor suite with views over the pool and the hills beyond. The room had every desired amenity and was quiet and tranquil. Every staff member we encountered was polite and helpful.   The hotel offers a very nice pool deck with a large, inviting swimming pool. Next door to the hotel is the modern Hartono shopping mall which offers a number of shops, casual restaurants, a food court, and a hypermarket.  There is a spacious club lounge on the ground floor which offers a limited breakfast spread and evening snacks. Guests can also take breakfast in the restaurant which features a bountiful buffet of?

Borobudur: Do not skip this Temple from your destination you will find the new Borobudur... Facilities, Route and the rule.  Borobudur yes Indonesia Raya....
Prambanan: I believe it?s a must-see temple in Indonesia. You can see different god and goddess. Easy to visit and please hire a professional guide for further information.
Sultan: Frustrating experience going to this place. They are currently renovating it but still kept it open. At least inform the visitors of the current situation before selling entrance tickets.   You will not see anything here except for people working on the construction.  We paid?
Malioboro: Shop after shop vendor after vendor. You can find almost anything here . From street food to batik to handbags. Haggling is necessary although the prices are so cheap it hardly matters. The street is alive 24 hours. It is 1 kilometer long. Aside from the street vendors there is?
Artotel: love the room so much. artistic. the food tastes very good. i went there with my boyfriend. he enjoyed and liked so much as well. we want to come here again very soon. so worthy stay here. see you soon!
Grand: Nice, new, clean and friendly. Rooms are spacious and clean and modern. Breakfast has many varieties. Took the whole family (12 of us) to the seafood buffet by the pool on level 5 and it was absolutely wonderful. Afterwards at the adjacent lounge (Arcadaz). The staff were wonderful and friendly and a special thank you to Ms Dini who welcomed us to the buffet and lounge she?s the most professional person in the whole of Jogjakarta. Will definitely be back.
Yogyakarta: From the moment we arrived at the hotel to moment we left, the high level of customer service we experienced was evident throughout the hotel. Breakfast was a banquet, served by staff who could not do enough to make the experience a wonderful occasion. The Executive Lounge was truly outstanding with Sofie, Dichy, Baim and Jovin making the experience memorable. Immense thanks and praise especially goes to Jovin who personally organised our onward travel plans to Jepara and then on to Karimunjawa Island. We really appreciated this extra effort and her local knowledge.

Borobudur: The Borobudur Temple is absolutely gorgeous and the surrounding parc is beautiful. I would 100% recommend going there when you?re in the area, even if it?s pretty pricy for Indonesia.   BUT I was shocked to see the condition of the animals there. The elephants are locked into a?

Sultan: No water was in the pools, just pile of rocks ! Was a very nice building and architecture ! Cost 15000.rph I think (1.5$ Canadian)
Malioboro: must visit...but do not forget bidding the price. so many batik and shirt (oblong) but be careful with the quality. and do not forget to eat satay (chicken), the price about IDR 15K for 10 satays
Artotel: Everything was excellent, room design, foods and service. I was staying for a business trip and it exceeded my expectation. I could check in an hour early, though I was given smoking room due to availability prior to 2 pm, the room smelled just fine. Really worth it.
Grand: I stayed here for 2 nights and it was a right decission i made. The hotel is considered new, the lobby, restaurant and public area were just meeting the expectation. The food was so so but anyway its Yogyakarta, you are suppose to explore the local food outside.  The room was beyond my expectation. It was spacious, clean, with comfy bed, and just enough to cater traveler?s need of a good rest.  Service delivered was average but meeting our expectation..  With it?s location that is near to airport and city center.. i would definately come back and recommend this hotel to others. Well, i did..
Yogyakarta: I stayed in this hotel for four nights. During my stay I was feeling sick and needed a doctor.  The hotel staff did everything to make my stay perfect, despite that I felt sick. A hotel nurse visited me before the doctor came to visit me. The staff and the manager of the restaurant and the M Club staff went above and beyond to fulfill my needs and offer me options that would make me feel better. As a titanium elite I was treated like a VIP guest and the hospitality was always genuine and warm.  I stayed in a (junior) suite which had all the comfort one would need. The room was quiet, modern, clean and comfortable. The food offered in the club lounge looked good and varied every day, although I did not eat much of it. Some spirits are offered, next to beer, wine  soft drinks,?

Borobudur: Fascinating and stunning. Take the sunrise tour as it is quieter, cooler and the views are amazing. Highly recommend.

For the price we paid, ~?4000/r/n include various option of bfast, it?s very a good deal.  There are some good places to hang out nearby (Kakimilk, the famous Tempo Gelato and sort of).  Artistic hotel with various art work such as painting, interior, furniture and so on.  We are very happy with our stay and we wish to come back another time.
Grand: We stayed 4 nights in this great located hotel. Really nice restaurant, great variety of food, indonesian but also international. Fitness room and pool are a plus after a long day in the crowded and hot Yogyakarta.  All the staff is really nice and helpfull. Special mention of Andhy KURNIAWAN, the FB supervisor, whose attention has been memorable, looking after all the details. Great job guys!!! Thank you!
Yogyakarta: Good hotel with horrible staff and service. Room is very spacious. Hotel is still in good condition as it is only a few years old. However, the staff and service is horrible. Borobudur: I?m having a short trip to yogyakarta a while a go with some of my friends. It was the unplanned trip so we didn?t know where to go. After strolling through the internet, we found yogyakarta local tours. It has a great review so we decided to contact them, and we don?t regret?

We were asking for double bed, it turned out to be two single bed joined. But the bed itself its very comfy. Breakfast choices were not much. Couple of times it was empty even though it still 8.30, not refilled until I ask them. Overall we like the hotel and we really love to come back or any other Artotel hotels.

Borobudur: It was a great visit to the historic and magnificent Borobudur temple which we had planned for quite a long time. Only drawback, it was a very hot & sunny day lol. We were sun burnt by 4pm on that Saturday, 16 November! My friend and I took many nice and beautiful photos. It?

Only the shower door is bad designed. But not a big deal. The room is clean and nice. Enjoyed my stay there.
Grand: Upon my arrival in this fresh and newly open hotel I greeted by their very attentive staffs.  The design looks really nice and modern. What an intention to detail! You?ll love the breakfast selection, traditional and modern... they have jamu for breakfast and that?s just perfect to me.  The problem is only one, it took some time or?

The only downside during our stay was our bathroom was leaking so there were puddles of water and they are smelly. Called the concierge but since this was after midnight, nobody picked up the call.

Borobudur: Going to temple in May to August ... and just going in the sunrise time... You can look how God give us alive .... Very beautiful...

Artotel: Great art Hotel, I was stay for 4 nights with family is, kids loved the art on the wall & the slide from M floor to Lobby <U+0001F44D>. Location is great. Grand: Stayed here for business trip. A very good hotel, comfortable, nice breakfast, great service. Also great location. If they could offer free shuttle from/to airport would be a great plus since I just found out that the taxi in Jogjakarta airport does not follow argometer and the price is highly unreasonable.
Yogyakarta: I tried to get an early check in after a long drive. The receptionist said that no room was available because the night before the hotel was fully booked. She charged my credit card for guarantee and asked me to return after 3.00 pm.  When we finally checked in, one of the rooms (650) had a broken door.  The duty manager said that the room has not been used in a while.  We had to wait for around 30 minutes before they moved us to room 630.   We were faced with a similar situation when we had our breakfast:  we were told to wait ( beside the dirty table) because the restaurant staff had to clean the table,  even though there were many empty clean tables available.  Overall it was really ridiculous especially after later I found out from Marriot Bonvoy email that I can do an early?

Borobudur: Been many times over the past years at the Borobudur but this was my first sunrise visit. It?s always great to be here. The entrance was included with a breakfast.
Prambanan: We arrived to the Prambanan Temple on the public bus 1A, from the Malioboro street in Yogyakarta. The ride took 45 minutes and the bus was not crowded at all; the buses run every 15 min and the one way ticket price is ~4K IDR; the tickets are sold by the bus company staff at the?
Sultan: Like many things in Indonesia, this is another overrated place. I don?t know if it?s been like this for some time, but point is, we went there and it?s just rubbish. When you get in there?s 2 pools, one was full of broken concrete blocks, gumboots and other stuff. The other one?
Malioboro: Malioboro is the most famous street in Yogyakarta. Located in the heart of the city, this is the main street and was once the ceremonial avenue for the Sultan to pass through on his way to and from the Keraton. Some say that the name Malioboro derives from the name of the?
Artotel: Great design, interesting local artists concept per floor. Comfy bed, good room size, Phone in room and wifi not working. Bad breakfast quality, most of them are not even warm, roast chic was cold. Walls are thin. Great location
Grand: The Hotel located near big Mall so it is easy to find yummy food and nice restaurant at the Mall. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room is big but you can hear voice from outside the room especially when people talk loudly. Breakfast is good and have many variety.
Yogyakarta: I stayed for the weekend with my wife in July 2019, in Room 901, a Club Pool Room.  The room was fantastic, exceptionally well appointed, modern and clean with lovely furnishings. It is at the end of the Hotel with a view overlooking the pool and provides a beautiful sunset.  The associates at the hotel are all lovely, always smiling and genuinely wanting to help. Tiara and Mona from the M Club lounge were particularly wonderful and friendly.  The food is great, breakfast offers a vast selection and the eggs Benedict were scrumptious. The selection in the M Club lounge is obviously limited in comparison to the full restaurant, but the associates will bring you whatever you ask for.   The M Club lounge is very relaxing and a nice place to unwind from the day exploring Yogyakarta.?

Borobudur: This temple is really huge and fantastic. Even though the admission fee is really expensive, but it is worth to visit, as least once in our lifetime. For those who like to learn about the life of Buddha and the past, this would be the wonderful place for you. The sculptures on?
Prambanan: We visited the Prambanan temples in the morning (not for sunrise), the next day after we visited Borobudur (we bought the combined tickets). It was worth it to pay for the 1-hour guide (we found a French speaking guide inside the temple for 150k/hour). Count 2 hours in total.
Sultan: I am quite shocked to find So many of jogjakarta?s most important tourist sites are closed  So early the kraton especially . I was whizzed through because  It was closing at 3 pm .. but with extra tips I got to stay another hour  ... I found it stunning especially on a rainy day?

Artotel: A very nice hotel with a very good access to all I need...Need a break...coffee shops were around..Got a problem with my mobile...just on foot to the solutionAirport is just 20 minutes by online ride..All the needs are nearby
Grand: Hotel location very superb , in the heart of main road jogja  Rooms - quite huge with modern design for 4 stars bed was ok   Food - food was ok , the variety of traditional foods need to be improved , taste so so   Cleanliness - Since this new brand all is consider good   Keep up the good work and definiately come back here when visit Jogja
Yogyakarta: We were trying to decide whether it was better to stay in downtown Yogyakarta or on the outskirts at this hotel.  We chose the Marriott and were very glad we did! I had some extra suite night awards which I applied to our stay, resulting in an upgrade to a junior suite.  The room had tons of space and was very modern and comfortable.  The hotel itself was in a great location next to Hartono Mall, which was a handy spot for eating and shopping.  The staff was extremely friendly and did their best to make our stay comfortable.  Breakfast had an elaborate spread, which was nice way to start the day.  All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would gladly return.

Borobudur: Highly recommend the Sunrise tour here - depart at Manohara, which include breakfast, which we did not rush after the sunrise as most of traveller rush to another temple. Suggest to have spend at least 5-6 hours(from sunrise till lunch time). As less crowd and you able to explore?
Prambanan: Entering the temple around 4 pm gives you enough time to enjoy the temples and with a bit of luck you can enjoy the sunset. Its an amazing temple, highly recommend this.
Sultan: Place is not very large, walk for few minutes. Buildings are not in very good shape, generally nothing special to see here, but if you have time try to stop by.

Yogyakarta: Special thanks to the staff members at the M Club lounge who made our stay extremely special: Chitra, Dichi, Sofie, Tiara, and Mona. We visited during the super busy Eid holiday period, which stretched the hotel is capacity, but we were extremely well cared for by the Club lounge staff members, who were always efficient and professional. Marriott Bonvoy Elite recognition is very good at this property and the Club lounge is excellent. Will recommend to others and would love to stay again at this property.

Borobudur: An awesome place. Itu was constructed fr lave stones without any nails, is a 9th century buddhist tample.
Prambanan: Prambanan is a wonderful temple complex, not far from Yogjakarta. I went there on the back of a scooter , which I arranged through ViaVia. I had a great young woman driver , and we went through back ways and villages , which took a bit less than an hour. I would not advise?
Sultan: One of the visiting destinations in Jogya that offers Old Javanese Flavors. In this place you will feel in the past. For young couples, this place becomes a dream as a wedding photo location
Malioboro: You can get some cheap pants and tshirts here. Only opens from about 6pm onwards. Nice to walk and absorb the culture.
Artotel: The art concept for overall part of hotel design is unique and make a different ambience for your room, the interior design is cool..with unique furniture concept. The hotel location surround by various culinary resto and cafe that make you feels at home
Grand: Excellent hotel <U+0001F44D><U+0001F3FB> In front of Ambarrukmo Plaza Very strategic location It?s Clean, comfy, luxurious, good service, good food, good ambiance, and great gym with good equipments. Definitely will be back here again
Yogyakarta: Stayed for a week during business trip Located on the ring road of Yogyakarta and connected to a new mall make this hotel a strategic place to stay Room was very spacious with all the amenities you expected from 5star hotel, provided fruits in the room also However not bathtub just regular shower in a big bathroom Breakfast was good with lots of selection and numerous local dish Fitness room was big and pool was very instagramable A great stay for business purpose however not seeing man family maybe because not having any children activities True to the world standart, first class business hotel

Borobudur: I went to Borobudur around 4am in the morning, it was amazing to see the sunrise on this beautiful site. There were people but not crowded, i was able to walk around and be alone. But if you want to stay watching the sunrise come earlier because people were sitting and didn?t?
Prambanan: The temples are beautiful but why is there a mini zoo? The animals and birds are in tiny miserable cages. :(
Sultan: The grounds were pretty (flowers and architecture), but there was not any information about what we were looking at. It was mainly guesswork and imagination. I would not recommend spending too much time here. It is nice for a quick, unique stop on your way to other sites.
Malioboro: This is not ordinary road, you can find anything here: culture, food, people, shopping centre, history
Artotel: I really love to stay at the hotel. It has a really great staff and ambiance; interior, spacious and clean room, and many more. It was really nice to have a really comfortable room after a tiring day exploring Jogja.
Grand: Absolutely value for money. Great location, hospitality, comfort, breakfast, service, rooms, etc<U+0001F60A> Only negative was the ala carte dinner - terribly pathetic portion! Ordered a chicken breast and it was barely simply the size of one kfc drumstick plus a serving or overly salty salad..
Yogyakarta: We stayed with family booked 3 rooms during Ied Holiday. The staffs of course friendly and helpful. Tried the Quan Spa right after I arrived driving long hours from Solo and it was very nice :)  My highlights were :  1) Thann amenities - they smell so nice and doesn?t make my skin dry like other hotel?s bathroom amenities. My aunt even said that their shampoo is better than her current shampoo at home. 2) Breakfast - for me the breakfast are satisfying. Getting a little bit bored from usual hotel breakfast and surprisingly they serve my favorite bandung siomay with peanut sauce. It was delicious like the authentic bandung siomay!! Other dishes are also nice like pastries, french toast, indonesian beef steak, dimsum etc. they also serve choice of healthier egg to be cooked (ex:?

Borobudur: We had a driver to bring us around for the day, starting with the sunrise at Borobudur. Set off at 3.30am in the morning from Malioboro. The admission into the Borobudur park for Sunrise costs IDR475K. The view and sight were indeed spectacular for Sunrise, the structure was?
Prambanan: Beautiful temple site yet over crowded with local tourist at times. If you are an admirer of historical site, try your best to visit really early morning, or at close to sunset (around 4.30 onwards), i would recommend to come close to sunset as most of local tourist left already?
Sultan: cool place to wander around with friends can learn a lot of cool things inside every wall have a story. Too many people from  tour group bring your own water bottle prepare entrance fee local fee is much much cheaper than for visitors from other country
Malioboro: Malioboro street as the central city of Jogja , there is the busy area and the central of tourists coming from Indonesia also abroad, not complete for travellers when visiting Jogja without visiting Malioboro, you Will see the real of Jogja in there, more information contact?
Artotel: Super nice, comfy, unique hotel.When I first enter, I could feel that this hotel was build by passion.The color & arrangement was really in order.Stay here is really good experience for me.Definitely will come back real soon for another staycation.
Grand: Stayed for two nights to attend business trip to Jogja. Checking out of the hotel with hard feeling as I still want to enjoy the hotel with its service and facility much more  Lobby is just nice, compact but gives the feeling of comfortable.  Only the centerpiece at the middle of lobby might be reviewed but I am sure they change it periodically. When I stayed there it was ?wedding theme? and not too match with the overall hotel concept. Not a big deal as it is only my opinion, others might be like it much.  Front desk agent was friendly and explained all what guest needs. Room was great. They now what is the meaning of comfort and apply it there. Not too big but spacious and easy for the mobilization in the room. Two thumbs up for the room d?cor, all perfectly picked and done.?
Yogyakarta: I open 4 rooms during Ied holiday for family vacations, been staying here few times and seems like it become one of our family favorite. Property was brand new, well maintained, luxurious and grand. The other plus point is its located at the same complex with big mall, this makes my stay so easy as im travelling with young kids.  Arrived at 3pm, check and was smooth, attentive and friendly staff. Book 2 kind of rooms, twin and double bed room.  Double bed provide somekind of sofa, which can be use for bed for 2 adults. This room perfect for travellers whi brought nanny, as they can sleep in this sofa. Room was clean, spacious, comfortable, good bed, great pillow.  Bathroom was also nice, no bath tub, gooda aminity and good water pressure. The only minus point is door CANNOT be?

Borobudur: We visited the Borobudur temple for the sunrise. The temple is a multiple level structure. There are many rock steps to take to reach the top. You must be physically fit to reach the top level.  Each level of the temple is small and needs around 15 minutes for a quick walk. But?
Prambanan: Very cool temple compound. It was an even better experience than Borobudur. There?s so many things to see and you can choose your own mode of transport from walking, buggy, cycling and so on. I had fun walking through the ancient ruins and visiting all the different Temples and?
Sultan: Sadly, this site has not been well-maintained. The small garden area was unkempt, though it could be lovely. There was a pile of plastic bottles there  and the shrubs and grass were not manicured. See the three swimming pools but do not expect a "palace". It is a bare bones place.
Malioboro: Very crowded road, especially during New Year Eve. The whole surrounding are (from North to South) were full with people! Be careful with your wallet and your belongings. There are so many batik and souvenirs store (woven, wood, bamboo, leather) along the street.  The prices are?
Artotel: It was my 1st time stay in Artotel, I liked it. For me, the location is in the center so its near to the place i want go. Roca is food is good!! Nice ambiance and nice room. The staff are helpfull as well.
Grand: Room decor is nice and cozy.Bed is very comfortable. The rain shower pressure is excellent. Breakfast is good not a lot of variety though. Coffee is very good. Very close to the airport(10 minute maximum if there is no traffic jam) It is just opposite Plaza Ambarrukmo where you can have your meals and grab stuff. Lastly the staff are friendly too.
Yogyakarta: I?m not gonna tell a story but directly my review about this hotel. Room is big enough for kids run here and there. Twin bed 160x200 + 1 sofa bed, or King bed 200x200 + 1 long sofa bed. Actually we will still comfy with 5 adults in room. We booked for 3 deluxe rooms. (1 single bed , 2 twin bed). Those are the cheapest option.  I?m little bit disappointed with the AC system in twin bed room. The wind blows directly to our face when we sleep at bed near window. Although we set the fan to low. But its not happened in room with king bed.  Interior is stunning, big screen TV, maybe 50inch, digital panel for AC, small refrige, luxury wall design that makes you even comfier and JBL Horizon bluetooth speaker in every room is the best part of it haha.  Bathroom also stunning, with 2 side?

Borobudur: We came in vip way so we came in short cut way to this place. This place is very historic. But when we came there, was too crowded. We even can not go up to the stairs because too many people stuck on stairs. Some wanted to go up but in the same time same wanted to fo down. So?
Prambanan: I visit this place many times since Elementary school and never bored to visit this over and over. The problem is this place not a stroller friendly like in Borobudur.
Sultan: Tamansari is located near the palace. It has a rich history and is filled with local people interested in their own history. There were many many many freelance (and persistent) local guides on site and we were advised by our driver to ignore them. True enough, they were sticky?
Malioboro: It is a very crowded street. You can buy all sort of clothing is and souvenirs! There is a lot of street food available down the road. It is great to visit in late afternoon. The fist five minutes of walk I walk into Baltic Art scam, the guy says, we have a free exhibition from?
Artotel: I do recommend this place while your staying in Jogja, new vibe is awaiting for you. Best place to hangout with your friends as well or even a mini reunion. 20minutes from main airport and 15-20mins to downtown. The staff is cool, energetic, they can be your friends!
Grand: Stayed 2 nites in this 6 month old hotel to attend cousin is wedding at their sister hotel across the street. Very nice clean and comfortable hotel. The staff are very kind, polite and warm. Room size is good and breakfast is fantastic. Complimentary shuttle to Ambarrukmo Plaza dan Royal Ambarrukmo Hotel is provided. Very convenient especially during rainy season. Overall will stay again next time in Jogja.
Yogyakarta: Musty smell in pillow sheet (not smell good) and chicken karaage in breakfast hard to bite. The staff really nice and helpful especially for tirta in front office. Overall the facilities in hotel are perfect! Thank you for your hospitality.

Borobudur: Going there from malioboro took more than an hour via bike though the scenery on way saved us. We reached at 4:30 so people there advised us to buy a sunset ticket instead . It was 475000 idr each and included a souvenir and dinner at manohara Restaurant. And even at sunset u?
Prambanan: It was a miserable hot afternoon and we had just finished a very satisfying lunch with a cold local beer. Not a good beginning for sightseeing. However, the 9th century Temple complex was definitely worth a visit. There are a total of 240 temples, large and small within the?
Sultan: this place is really beautiful. this is the first time my family and I have come here. really a very recommended place if you are on vacation in Yogyakarta
Malioboro: Malioboro Road is a busy street with views of stunning dutch colonial buildings and President Office & Residence. There are lots of trishaws and horse drawn carriages for rent to those who feel too tired to walk .   Along the wide pathway , peddlers has their goods on display?
Artotel: nice room with city view, breakfast with delicious food and variate menu, artistic room with a unique theme and good acoustic. swimming pool with nice view, maybe some balloon and floating mattress need to be added.
Grand: The rooms were spacious with top class amenities and furniture. It felt like staying at a 5 star hotel instead of a 3.5 one. Breakfast had a very various selections from traditional local culinary to international appetite. The staffs are very kind, polite and helpful. The interior are spaciously designed so you will not notice it is actually situated at a pretty tight yet strategic enclosure in the middle of bustling Yogyakarta. The wifi is also very accessible at every spot of the hotel. They also offer connected rooms which are excellent for families. Very recommended!
Yogyakarta: An excellent hotel, new and staff are super attentive....we stayed during Eid so was very busy and a little noisy as our room overlooked the pool....would recommend this as a base to explore Yogyakarta and surrounds!

Borobudur: Our Sunrise Borobudur experience came to a shocking halt at the ?Elephant House? .. more like an elephant torture chamber.  Seeing baby elephants chained, crying, trying to break away with their trunks ? with no room to walk under the sweltering heat. THIS IS NOT A WAY TO END?
Prambanan: If you are in the Yogyakarta / Surakarta area the ancient Hindu temples at Prambanan are a must see.   The temples are about a 1,000 years old and reflect Java?s pre-Islamic Heritage.   The exit is lined with vendors selling all kinds of touristy rubbish, but it?s all part of?
Sultan: Located within walking distance from the Sultan Palace is this Taman Sari Building, the Taman Sari Water Castle. With a combination of eastern & western architecture build by a Portugese, the building is adorned with numerous Javanese ornaments, its old grandeur still could be?
Malioboro: At Malioboro Road Tonight.  Many people at here tonight.  Holiday Time at Central Yogyakarta City at Malioboro Road.   Good many batik in here.  Many purchase special Yogyakarta in here  Special food Yogya Gudeg many choice in Malioboro Road.
Artotel: I really enjoyed my stay here! Artsy wall, coffee machine, spacious room, large size bed, minimalist bathroom. Really comfortable and the location is very great. Worth the price and I will be back to this hotel for my next visit!
Grand: We?re staying here from 30 December - 3 January 2018. Seem like brand new hotel, I love the bed so comfortable, the room is very clean and tidy every single day. Buffet breakfast every single morning with variation menu and typical Javanese menu. Small pool and gym on 5th floor. The stuff is very friendly and helpful. Very good location just in front of Ambarrukmo plaza and 10 minutes from airport. Easy find grab car in Yogyakarta. Our stay including New year celebration, they give us: goodie bag, ticket for the local artist show, funny foto shot, delicious buffet dinner, and watching firework that come from Ambarrukmo Plaza. For me personally worth to stay in this hotel.
Yogyakarta: i stay in this hotel for two nite with my mother. i really enjoyed stay in the hotel.beside the hotel, there are shopping complex.my mother so happy to stay in the hotel and wheelchair friendly and hotel staff really very good and friendly

Borobudur: The largest Buddhist temple in the world, Borobudur is high on visual appeal in terms of its size as well as intricacies. The stupa at the center and the myriad structures around it are awe-inspiring. Gives you a unique peek into the influence of Buddhism in these parts in?
Prambanan: If you have seen Angkor Wat, skip this.  If you have not, save the money to see it instead.  This is a rip-off (of foreigners; locals pay 1/10.  True at Borobudur also and everywhere else in Indonesia but none as bad as Prambanan and Borobudur).
Sultan: Place has great history! Although it was quite a challenge looking around, must say this is a must visit in Jogja!
Malioboro: We are love Jogjakarta and Malioboro street. But becareful about scam there, especially for Batik Art. My tips: 1. Do not buy any Batik Art in the first day you come. Makesure you learn about the prices in several places. 2. Do not ever tell someone on the street it is your first?
Artotel: Location OK, interior OK, room OK but not sound proof, you can hear noise from next door, bathroom OK but a bit small, not recommend for fat people. The girl receptionists were not helpful and didn?t greet us if we didn?t greet them, but not the boys, they?re cool.
Grand: Room is spacious. The single beds are big, clean, comfy and sleep was effortless. However, the lights are dim and I could only get a city view. Sewer smell was quite bad in the bathroom.  Laundry service was very expensive and late. Had to call them to get my clothes delivered. Got more than 500 IDR bills for just laundering T-shirts. Regret taking the laundry and should have bought new ones instead. Breakfast was of nothing special.  It is a walk distance from Ambarrukmo Plaza. But I just can not justify the price, you would better off staying in other hotels when you visit Yogyakarta.
Yogyakarta: A great hotel with a wonderful staff and great amenities! Located 15-minutes from the airport and is connected to a great mall, it is ideal.  I was fortunate enough to reserve a room with lounge access and its staff was excellent, especially Jovin, who is one of the nicest and helpful individuals I have met anywhere in the world.  Not only did she make my stay pleasant and provided great travel tips, she arranged to mail my phone to me, which I accidentally left behind in the safe in my room.    In short, I highly suggest this hotel. I have been to Jogja 5-times and this is by far the best hotel!

Borobudur: This marvelous temple can not be missed if you visit Jogya. It can be easily reached by bus and bus ticket very cheap if you are residing in the central Jogya.Though the entrance ticket is expensive it remains a wonderful place to visit. Without forgetting the poeple waiting at the?
Prambanan: A really nice temple, but it can get very crowded on public holidays, so try to avoid those. A must visit though. About 1 to 2 hours should do it. If you want to stroll through the surrounding park you will need more time.
Sultan: When you hear the stories about the water palace from the tour guide, and walking through the courtyard and rooms, you get a sense of being actually there and can imagine the daily lives of the people of long ago staying there. Very interesting. A must visit!
Malioboro: I wanted to look for a good quality yet reasonable price batik and as I look up in Tripadvisor, i was told to visit Hamzah Batik in Malioboro Street.   Its right at end of Malioboro street and is a building to itself that says ?Hamzah Batik?.   I bought around 15 items with such?
Artotel: Smooth check in, good breakfast spread, cosy room, clean bathroom. We were told that the walls are thin enough that you would be able hear noise from outside but we had no such issue. Also perhaps having room at corner helped. Overall very satisfied for the price we pay.
Grand: I went to restaurant inside Grand Ambarukmo hotel and had lunch and took their Business Lunch menu which they had brochure everywhere. When we arrives we have been told that the menu of Sayur Lodeh is not available, while actually there are another 2 menus option which they did not offer. I took menu of Soto Lamongan set. What a bad service from them, it took almost 50 minutes to get all my food. The first 15 minutes they only offer Kerupuk and water without asking if I want to have another drink, 30 minutes I ask again and they said wait a moment, 45 minutes I ask again and they said almost done and I almost want to walk out and the entree Soto Lamongan came up. The taste was horrible that is not Soto Lamongan taste that is more to Soto Betawi taste. When the main course came out?
Yogyakarta: This is my second stay after  my maiden stay in Nov-2018. So I will not repeat all the good things that I have mentioned in my first review.  I personally think, the hotel deserves a 5 star rating now.   The 2 main complains that I have highlighted in my first review that did not get them 5 stars have been addressed.   They are using Thann amenities (at least in the higher category room) and they have installed a switch for the bath room, which I personally did not expect them to do it in short 6 months period as this is really quite a significant changes.   But they did it....   So I do not have anymore reason not to give them 5 stars rating.  Superb team.   Very attentive. From bell boy and security at the door, to the Club lounge staff and restaurant and all the way through?

Borobudur: Before my visit in October 2019, I read some reviews about the ticket. I just want to share the most recent price for international travelers. The combined ticket for two temples is 45 USD (630,000 IDR) You can visit the temples in two consecutive days. The ticket can be?

Sultan: This place is no doubt interesting and worth a picture or two on a sunny day, however it?s not something to focus your day on. If it?s part of a package sure it?s worth a sneaky look but that is it.
Malioboro: Wide pathway for walking but still need to be careful due to 2 lane single direction traffic going through. Plenty of benches for tourist to rest a little before continuing the shopping. Most of the shops sell batik clothing and fabric, which Yogja is famous for. Lots of trisha?
Artotel: Excellent room services, but the breakfast food has less variety and the dinner course was too salty. Definitely recommended for the room services, but the food and beverages needed some improvement in the future.
Grand: I had lunch last week and try taste the lunch package menu, i was really not satisfied your staff explaination, 1. Your menu is not ready as part lunch package menu but not ready in lunch time 2. Finally the menu ready to sale even thought 1 package according your staff still on prepared 3. Your menu which i ordered really not the same with your package, coto makassar on the menu but showed up soto lamongan however not put chicken instead beef 4. It takes almost 45 - 50 minutes to delivered the menu. In my opinion, you are ready selling package menu but your not ready prepare to sell it, why? You can answer by your team. 5. After i upset with no 1-4 luckily the taste make me satisfied compare with the price.  So i advise please make some change related my review in that time. ?
Yogyakarta: This one hotel is a great place to stay for 5 star services and still not hurt your pocket. The room is clean and big. Good bed for good sleep. All the staffs were great. Yes, all. Greeting us with a smile everytime we met and always ready to assist us in every way. Each day we started our day with great smiles and chats from the breakfast buffet staffs and it went the whole day. I also had a wonderful massage at Quan Spa. The massuer was very good. There is a mall beside for all the convenience. The hotel provides shuttle to Maliboro street for souvenir shopping on weekends.

Borobudur: Beat the crowd, take the sunrise tour and exprience the magic when the sunlight hits the stones. You also get to explore the grounds before huge crowds arrive at the site.   Get a guide, its very important if you are not familiar with the history of Buddha and Buddhism in Java.?
Prambanan: Shadowed, in the methaphorical sence, by Borobodur, but worth a visit!!! Just be prepared to do some walking, if you do not want to wait for the shuttle. Good idea is probalby to walk one way, and return for the most far away point.
Sultan: Interesting architecture. There are freelance guides around to share with you the background and history of the place. Was told that the 2 pools in front of the tower was where the women and the children frolicks while the king watches over the tower. The king was said to throw?
Malioboro: Don?t miss it when visit to Jogja. Better in the low season, make you comfort walking a while sightseeing and shopping ofcourse!
Artotel: Friendly hotel crews are always ready for the call, artsy sense on each floor. A slide from the 2nd floor to the ground floor for kids to try! The breakfast served was not exceptionally amazing, but enough to satisfy the customers needs.
Grand: Hotel is new, stay for2 nights, check in fast and they were all really try to accomodate guest need. Room big and good bed, very clean and still new. Location is in front the ambarukmo plaza mall and not far from airport.   Breakfast have variety and taste good, staff in restaurant also well respinse.   We took shuttle service to airport with good price.   We will come back again!
Yogyakarta: nice room, clean and big space yummy breakfast with thousand of choices good location to go to the Hartono Mall the swimming pool is good the ballroom very big for Jogja but food service maybe making better next time, I came for mr Kuswanto birthday invitation

Borobudur: The temple itself is magnificent. But in the light of the rising sun is even more spectacular. I would surely reccomend the Sunrise tour, it also includes a hearty self-service breakfast.
Prambanan: Wonderful Hindu Temple Site.  Very interesting historical site and a great place to spend an hour or two.  Worth a visit.
Sultan: We went not expecting to see much here, but were astonished by the size of the remains as well as the interesting aspects of it. Definitely get a guide, as hard to navigate it all and a lot can be explained. There is far more here than simply the pools normally seen in photos,?
Malioboro: Went there at about 6pm on a Saturday and the street was bustling. Hamzah Batik is a must to go for those who are looking to get some batik or Indonesian handicrafts without the hassle of haggling as the price are indicated and fixed. The atmosphere was vibrant with many street?
Artotel: It is location are really strategic, near food & convenient store. The linen & bed are very clean & comfy. It has 42  tv and a dolce gusto coffee machine. The view on the 9th floor is breath taking, you can see merapi when there is no cloud. The wifi is tolerable. Food for breakfast are great even tho the food variety are not varies for long stay. Overall I do recommend to stay in Artotel, I hope I am able to stay in this hotel again soon.
Grand: Nice new hotel and clean.  Staff all very nice and try to be as helpful as possible.  Many are still in training however eager to help.  Restaurant staff helpful however need to check on guests or be looking out when a customer is requesting assistance. Thank you Retno for looking after our group during our stay in Yogyarkarta.
Yogyakarta: Warm and friendly staff. Really appreciated them going extra mile to make birthday weekend special.  Food in restaurant was excellent. The pool was relaxing and not too crowded.  Convienently located next to a mall and supermarket; yet close to authentic restaurants and sites.    Thank you.

Borobudur: We were on a 3 day tour of Java sutes. This was the higlight. You could obtain a pass at a cost to go to top for sunrise. Still a lot of people and uncertain sun as it was beginning rainy season. There are a lot of steps and few handrails. As there are 7 layers its possible to?

Sultan: A great destination for a foot work, it?s near alun-alun and you only need to pay IDR 5000/person (domestic) + add on IDR 3000 ( camera )
Malioboro: The Malioboro street is great especially during the nite. Variety of food could.be found. But you would better check the price first.
Artotel: We enjoyed everything about our stay here, starting with the arrival process, the entrance/lobby areas are interesting, and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful with different style like barnas, its a good point, so please keep your different in positive way. About room,  tis simple but with the sense of art, we was not bored to stay, the bed was extremely comfortable. good wifi was accessible.
Grand: Pleasant stay with wonderful hospitality provided by the staffs. From the moment we checked in till check-out, we are taken care of in all aspect of our needs. Rooms are good and modern and service prompt. Breakfast is complete and selection changes everyday. Such a wonderful experience and definitely will come back to stay
Yogyakarta: Room size was really big. Very modern room with digital screen to control room?s temperature. Breakfast was great and full variety of food. Location was next to mall. Service also was really great. Overall it was a pleasure to stay in such a great hotel

Borobudur: We visited Borobudur temple on October 2, using the sunrise tour for the temple in the morning and the volcano tour in the afternoon. I highly recommend this schedule since we avoided the afternoon heat in the temple, and enjoyed the cool mountain weather. One thing I noticed is?
Prambanan: Large ancient Hindu temple set in delightful gardens. Make sure you take a guide to learn the full history of this amazing place.  Mid week visit very quiet so felt like I had the place to myself. Local handicraft markets here as well.
Sultan: I explored several places in the Watercastle Complex, really a very interesting historical place, clean environment and a preserved culture.
Malioboro: Malioboro is the main street in Yog where you find families out for meals at night and locals and tourists shopping from the many stores.   There are quite a few street side eateries too, serving typical local food including fried chicken and grilled fish.   Do pay a visit?
Artotel: The hotel room feels comfortable, the bathroom is clean and the restaurant is also quite clean. There is also a variety of foods, good service so this place are very suitable to be a destination for staying and meeting
Grand: Even though this hotel is still in the soft opening stage but they manage to pull off a great service.  The have a perfect location in front of ambarukmo plaza and not too far from malioboro street.  Check in was easy.  The hotel staffs were super friendly and helpful.  The room was big warm and comfy.  Breakfast was generous and taste yummy.  Definitely will come back to stay in this hotel again.. Keep up the great work Grand Ambarrukmo <U+0001F44D>
Yogyakarta: Hotel is excellent and having very good location, attached to huge shopping mall ?Hartono Mall? where you can find many restaurants and foods beside all shopping you might need.  People in the hotel are very friendly and helpful, although it is relatively new but the staff are pro.

Borobudur: We did not take the sunrise special ticket but were the first at the gate. They offered coffee!  No sunrise that day but quite calm
Prambanan: Went there with kids. Lots of open spaces around but need to watch kids. But a must see if you are in the area or visiting Indonesia
